The future is advancing rapidly.

Driverless cars are no longer just concepts; they are currently being manufactured and tested.

While driverless cars have both positive and negative aspects, I believe they are not yet beneficial for society.

For cars to be autonomous, they must react promptly to any situation at any time and have faster response times than humans.

If a car possesses all these capabilities, it ceases to be just a car and becomes a robotic machine capable of making life-or-death decisions for its passengers and pedestrians.

However, at present, cars are not fully autonomous.

We have yet to develop the technology to create cars with the essential human qualities, such as natural reflexes to avoid obstacles.

The world we inhabit today is different from yesterday and will be different tomorrow.

Our current technology is progressing rapidly.

Today, it's smart cars, tomorrow, smart houses, and the day after, smart individuals.

While technology is beneficial, humans are so focused on constant improvement that they overlook the current advantages.

What will happen to the human race if we rely solely on technology and not on each other?

If driverless cars become the primary mode of transportation for short distances, humans may neglect to develop hand-eye coordination and reflexes.

This could lead to a decline in these essential motor functions.

With the rapid advancement of technology, humans are gradually regressing.

The introduction of smartphones and tablets has resulted in humans having shorter attention spans than previous generations.

Personally, I oppose driverless cars, as they will push society further into a technology-driven existence.

By relying on these advanced cars, we are entrusting our lives to technology, and this trend is likely to continue.

The future is introducing a myriad of new devices and gadgets to simplify and ease our lives, but who wants a mundane, technology-dependent existence, where everything is handed to us on a silver platter?

The world is witnessing a paradigm shift in the way we conduct daily activities amidst the ongoing coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. This shift affects various aspects of life, such as online learning, socializing, interaction, conducting business, and shopping. These global catastrophes have a profound impact on our social life, but not all cultures react and respond in the same way during a crisis. Even under normal circumstances, research suggests that people across different cultures reason differently [1]. For instance, in his book, "The Geography of Thought: How Asians and Westerners Think Differently... and Why," Nisbett states that East Asians think dialectically and holistically, while Westerners think logically, abstractly, and analytically [2]. Cultural behavior and attitudes are influenced by factors including the socio-economic situation, faith, belief systems, and lifestyle.

The COVID-19 crisis, in particular, highlighted greater cultural differences, even among countries that share similarities in language, history, and culture. For example, although Denmark and Sweden, two neighboring countries, speak almost the same language, and share a lot, they reacted very differently to the coronavirus [3].

The Facial Action Coding System, which enables computers to identify human emotions, could be highly beneficial for students in a classroom setting. I will present compelling reasons and examples to demonstrate why this technology would be advantageous for students. By the end of this discussion, you will fully understand my perspective and appreciate how this tool could enhance the classroom experience. Additionally, I will provide evidence to support my claims, allowing you to draw the same conclusion.

This technology, which reads students' emotional expressions, offers several benefits. It can inform teachers about how students feel regarding their assignments, alert them to any personal issues students might be facing, and, ultimately, reduce the dropout rate.

Firstly, the system can help teachers understand how students feel about their work. For instance, students may struggle with assignments but hesitate to speak up. By analyzing students' expressions, the technology can reveal when students are confused, enabling teachers to offer timely assistance. This insight, gained through the computer, can be invaluable for identifying students' academic challenges.

Secondly, the system can alert teachers to students experiencing personal difficulties, as indicated by their facial expressions. Consider, for example, a student enduring abuse at home, who, out of fear, chooses to remain silent.

Have you ever considered becoming a Seagoing Cowboy?

Well, you should definitely give it a try. Let me share with you why it's an incredible adventure filled with amazing sights, opportunities to help others, and various activities both on and off the ship.

Being a Seagoing Cowboy allows you to experience breathtaking sights that will stay with you for a lifetime. I once had the privilege of gazing upon the ancient Acropolis in Greece during my journey. By joining this endeavor, you could also witness remarkable places like this. Moreover, I had the chance to visit Europe and China – but one of the most awe-inspiring moments was witnessing Venice’s unique waterways. So, becoming a Seagoing Cowboy not only offers extraordinary views but also unforgettable experiences.

Participating in this program gives you the chance to lend a helping hand to those in need – an invaluable opportunity. Whether assisting communities recovering from war by rebuilding their towns or providing essential supplies such as animals or food, your contributions can make a significant impact. Helping others is a fundamental aspect of being a Seagoing Cowboy and another compelling reason for considering this role.

If you think there won't be much to do while onboard the ship, think again. From engaging in sports like baseball, volleyball, table tennis, fencing, boxing to quieter activities like reading or whittling – there's never a dull moment at sea. Additionally, fulfilling tasks such as cleaning animal stalls, feeding them or ensuring they have enough water are all part of your responsibilities aboard ship. These varied activities not only keep you occupied but also contribute towards making your time as a Seagoing Cowboy fulfilling.

Having learned about all these aspects of being involved in such an incredible venture; I hope it inspires you to become part of the Seagoing Cowboys' community soon!

Les citoyens du Vieux-Limoilou auraient préféré plus de détails sur les conséquences des deux tracés proposés, notamment en ce qui concerne la circulation de transit, les pertes de cases de stationnement et les expropriations, pour prendre une position éclairée. 

Ils étaient plus de 200 participants en ligne pour la première soirée de consultation publique sur le nouveau tronçon du tramway entre le pôle Saint-Roch et d'Estimauville. Deux scénarios sont envisagés : la ligne du tramway pourrait emprunter soit la 3e avenue, soit la 4e avenue pour rejoindre le chemin de la Canardière. 

L'équipe du Bureau de projet est encore au début de la démarche. L'objectif des rencontres est de sonder les citoyens sur leur préférence avant de se lancer dans des études plus techniques. "Rien n'est décidé d'avance", a pris soin de préciser Suzanne Verreault, la conseillère du district, dès le début de la séance. "On est au début de notre réflexion. On veut comprendre vos préoccupations", a ajouté Daniel Genest, le directeur du Bureau de projet.

Les citoyens de Limoilou avaient des questions précises pour chaque proposition. Véronique Yelle a demandé : "A-t-on des études qui permettent de prédire si la circulation dans le quartier diminuera grâce au tramway ou doit-on s'attendre à une déviation du trafic vers la 3e avenue ou la 4e avenue, selon l'option retenue ?" 

Marie-Claude Raymond s'est inquiétée de la place des ruelles : "Elles pourraient être utilisées par des automobilistes comme voie de contournement." Hélène Riverain a voulu savoir : "Si des expropriations sont nécessaires, quand les propriétaires seront-ils avisés ?"

À maintes reprises, les intervenants ont dû expliquer que la démarche était encore préliminaire et que les études seront menées une fois le choix du tracé arrêté. "Lorsqu'on aura fait un choix du tracé, il y aura des études qui seront faites et à ce moment-là, on viendra développer les mesures d'atténuation qui seront propres au scénario choisi", a expliqué Daniel Genest.

L'avenir de la place publique en plein cœur du quartier, Place Limouloise, a également suscité quelques questions. "La place Limouloise sera coupée en deux avec le tramway", s'est indigné Christian Beaulieu. Le Bureau de projet a voulu se montrer rassurant : si le tramway emprunte la 3e avenue, la place publique ne sera pas sacrifiée et elle sera même prolongée. Mario Laberge, un autre résident, a toutefois souligné qu'il sera impossible de fermer la 3e avenue lors d'événements spéciaux si le tramway doit passer sans interruption.

La consultation publique à distance a ses limites pour bien prendre le pouls des citoyens. Les questions étaient posées par écrit et lues par Marie Lagier, la responsable de la séance. Après plus de deux heures, l'exercice de questions et réponses n'a pas permis de déceler de quel côté penchent les citoyens. À plusieurs reprises, les différents intervenants les ont invités à remplir un questionnaire qui sera mis en ligne dès mercredi matin.

"Vous n'avez pas les réponses très précises auxquelles vous vous attendiez peut-être, mais je pense que vous avez bien compris la démarche. C'est une première étape", a déclaré Suzanne Verreault. Le tracé et l'emplacement des stations retenus devraient être connus en juillet. Le Bureau de projet reconnaît qu'il s'agit d'un calendrier serré et que des études viendront par la suite préciser tous les enjeux.

Dr. Pamela Jenkins was the director of clinical research at the Children's Healthcare of Atlanta. Recently, there had been a sudden influx of children exhibiting cold-like symptoms coupled with severe headaches that nearly incapacitated them, leaving them unable to form coherent sentences.

Shaking off the remnants of her own migraine and finishing her afternoon coffee—strong and black as usual—Pamela suddenly realized she was completely lost. Though she felt she was where she was supposed to be, she didn’t recognize the lab.

“Something isn’t right here,” she thought aloud. “Are the paint colors different, or maybe the lighting?”

She certainly didn’t recognize the thick-framed man staring at her intently. His brow was furrowed, deep wrinkles forming above his nose as if trying to merge his eyebrows with his cheeks.

With his head slightly tilted, he lowered his glasses and asked, “Pamela, right? Are you okay? Do you have my samples?”

“Samples? How do you know my name? Where am I?” she asked shakily. “What is your name?”

“I’m Dr. Schutz. You were bringing me six more samples of the viral D-147 from CHoA. You were here this morning. Call me Dennis.” Concern washed over his face, and his words were slow and deliberate, as though coaxing her memory back from its temporary departure.

“Oh, right,” she said with nervous laughter, still not remembering. She did recall working at the Children's Healthcare of Atlanta and routinely bringing samples to the CDC, but Dr. Schutz and this particular lab were unfamiliar. “Nice to meet you again.” She extended her right hand, reminding herself to squeeze firmly, as she always did with handshakes.

“Now, the samples?” Dennis asked hastily. “I almost have the vaccines complete. With these samples, I hope to finish the antigen in another day and eradicate this worrisome virus before more of your children are affected.” Pamela considered all the kids at CHoA her own, perhaps because she couldn't have children herself.

“Right here, Dennis.” She handed over the aluminum container, resembling a soup thermos. “Do you mind if I sit for a bit? I think I'm getting another migraine.” She took a seat in the lab chair, massaging her temples with her index fingers.

Dr. Schutz donned gloves and eagerly opened the sample case, carefully removing the first vial. He placed each vial inside the centrifuge on his benchtop, started the machine, and set the timer for 3.25 hours. He noted in his lab notebook: “2:42 PM Centrifuge started, 3.25 h– Final 6 samples; CHoA; Vaccine creation for D-147 – D. Schutz.”

“Wait, what am I doing here?” Pamela asked, her confusion evident. Her voice broke his concentration.

“You just dropped off some samples, remember? Dr. Jenkins, I think you need some rest.”

“Samples, no. The last thing I remember is waking up this morning. Then I got this terrible headache! Wait, what were the samples for?”

Dennis reached out, placing the back of his hand on her slightly sweaty forehead. “I think you have a fever, Pamela. You really should get checked out. The samples were for the D-147 variant of the recent viral outbreak.”

“Right, right. No, I remember the virus. I think I just need some rest,” she said. “I think I'll just go home for the day.” She slowly got to her feet and exited the CDC vaccination lab.

Dennis glanced at his watch, then at his notes. “About three more hours in the centrifuge,” he thought. “I could use a nap myself. I haven't slept in three days.” He waddled to his office, removed his glasses, and settled into his favorite desk chair. Propping his feet on the desk, he let the memories of the past days' work lull him to sleep.

BEEP BEEP BEEP! BEEP BEEP BEEP! BEEP BEEP BEEP!

The alarm from the centrifuge startled Dr. Schutz awake. His headache was pounding, almost louder than the incessant noise. As he rose, he realized he didn’t remember falling asleep in his office. He stumbled to the centrifuge, trying to recall the past few hours.

Bitcoin (CRYPTO: BTC) is the most well-known among cryptocurrencies, experiencing a significant price surge since its introduction. Notable financial experts, including Dave Ramsey and Suze Orman, have recommended investing in Bitcoin to some extent.

While investing in Bitcoin may offer potential returns, it shouldn't be the primary focus of your retirement savings strategy. Here's why:

Diversification is key, even with Bitcoin. Although Bitcoin has shown remarkable growth, its real-world application remains limited, and its track record is relatively short compared to traditional assets. The future of Bitcoin is uncertain, and its value is solely based on public perception, making it a risky investment that could result in long-term losses.

While Bitcoin may carry more risk than established investments like index funds or stocks, reliance on it alone to secure a comfortable retirement is unwise. A well-rounded retirement portfolio should not hinge on a single investment, whether it's Bitcoin, Apple shares (NASDAQ: AAPL), or an S&P 500 index fund.

Relying solely on one asset poses a high risk in retirement planning, as Social Security only replaces 40% of pre-retirement income. A diversified portfolio, including stocks, bonds, index funds, and possibly cryptocurrencies, can help mitigate risk while potentially increasing returns for retirement savings.

Practical factors also come into play, as most 401(k) plans do not allow investment in Bitcoin. It's important to allocate funds to traditional retirement accounts to benefit from employer contributions and ensure financial security in retirement.

If you believe in the future of Bitcoin and wish to include it in your investment strategy, that's fine. However, it shouldn't be your sole reliance for financial stability in retirement, as the viability of virtual currencies over time is uncertain.

In conclusion, maintaining a balanced investment portfolio is crucial for retirement planning. While Bitcoin may offer opportunities, it should be one component of a diversified portfolio tailored to meet your long-term financial goals. Remember, a thoughtful mix of assets can help secure a comfortable retirement lifestyle.

*Stock Advisor returns as of November 10, 2021

Christy Bieber has no position in any of the mentioned stocks. The Motley Fool owns shares of and recommends Apple and Bitcoin. The Motley Fool recommends options related to Apple.

أشار البنك الدولي في تقريره إلى أن الاقتصاد الفلسطيني سجل مؤخراً بوادر انتعاش، ومع ذلك يواجه تحديات خطيرة تشمل التوظيف والتمويل العام "المضطرب".
ووفقاً للتقرير، شهد الاقتصاد الفلسطيني تدهورًا في عام 2020 بسبب جائحة فيروس كورونا المستجد "كوفيد-19"، الأمر الذي أدى إلى زيادة الإنفاق على القطاع الصحي وتقليل عدد العمال الفلسطينيين في إسرائيل.
وأشار البنك إلى أن النمو الاقتصادي في الأشهر الـ6 الأولى من عام 2021 بلغ 5.4٪، مع التوقعات بارتفاع هذه النسبة إلى 6٪ بنهاية العام الجاري. ولكن حذر التقرير من أن وتيرة هذا النمو ستتباطأ في العام المقبل إلى حوالي 3٪ بسبب قلة المصادر.
ونقل التقرير عن مدير فرع البنك الدولي في الضفة الغربية وقطاع غزة، كانثان شانكار، قوله إن الطريق نحو تنشيط الاقتصاد وتوفير فرص عمل للشباب لا يزال غير واضح، ويرتبط بتعاون جميع الأطراف المانحين والسلطة الفلسطينية وإسرائيل وغيرهم.
وأظهر التقرير أن معدل البطالة في قطاع غزة، حيث يعيش حوالي مليوني نسمة، بلغ 45٪، بينما استمر معدل الفقر في الارتفاع ليصل إلى 59٪ حسب البيانات.
وبحسب البنك الدولي، يبلغ معدل البطالة حوالي 17٪ في الضفة الغربية المحتلة.
وأبدى البنك قلقه من الأوضاع المالية للسلطة الفلسطينية التي لم تعد قادرة على الاقتراض من البنوك المحلية، مما يؤدي إلى سحب المزيد من السيولة من السوق.
وتوقع التقرير عجزاً مالياً للسلطة الفلسطينية بقيمة 1.36 مليار دولار في 2021، مما يزيد من صعوباتها في تحقيق التزاماتها بنهاية العام.
وفي سياق آخر، ذكرت وزيرة الصحة الفلسطينية، مي الكيلة، تسجيل 7 وفيات و277 إصابة جديدة بفيروس كورونا، و471 حالة تعافٍ خلال الـ 24 ساعة الماضية.
وأضافت الكيلة في التقرير اليومي أن 5 حالات وفاة سُجلت في قطاع غزة و 2 في الخليل.
وأشارت الوزيرة إلى أن نسبة التعافي من الفيروس في فلسطين بلغت 98٪، وأن نسبة الإصابات النشطة 1٪ ونسبة الوفيات 1٪ من مجموع الإصابات.
وأشارت إلى وجود 58 مريضاً في غرف العناية المركزة، وأن 86 مريضاً يُعالجون في مراكز وأقسام "كورونا" في مستشفيات الضفة، بينهم 9 يعالجون بأجهزة تنفس صناعية.
وبلغ إجمالي جرعات التطعيم المعطاة في الضفة الغربية وقطاع غزة 2,677,660 جرعة.

宏达电近期宣布推出了一套全新的远距会议解决方案，通过结合其自家VR一体机Vive Focus、Focus Plus以及虚拟会议平台Vive Sync，为用户提供了一种无需使用电脑即可参与的高效远程会议体验。这一解决方案旨在帮助企业和消费者在疫情期间实现跨国团队的无缝沟通，同时提升远距工作的效率和沉浸感。

目前，远距会议和视讯会议已经成为欧美大型企业在抗疫期间的首选。宏达电表示，借助Vive远距应用解决方案，用户可以通过VR技术拥有接近面对面开会的真实体验。这套系统的最大亮点在于其便利性和功能性——用户只需通过Vive一体机Focus或Focus Plus，搭配Vive Sync平台，即可快速进入虚拟会议场景，无需额外配置电脑设备。

为了增强互动性，用户可以从苹果App Store或Google Play下载Sync XR Avatar Creator，创建属于自己的3D虚拟人像。一旦登录线上VR空间，用户便可开始体验如同真实世界般的面对面互动。宏达电指出，这项解决方案支持多人会议，并允许即时分享多种文件格式，涵盖企业培训、演说训练、远程会议及教学等多种应用场景。

Vive Sync还充分利用了VR的3D特性，提供突破传统视讯会议的功能。与会者可以在虚拟会议中展示并修改3D物件，例如将3D模型置入会议空间中，以360度视角向客户或团队进行演示，并直接在3D物件上标注或绘图。

El hondureño residente en Florida, Estados Unidos, Isahac Dubón, denunció que el periodista Milton Benítez se quedó con el dinero destinado a los damnificados durante los huracanes Eta y Iota, el cual fue enviado desde el país del norte. Abner Isahac Dubón Guevara exige a Milton Benítez, conocido como el "Perro Amarillo", que proporcione un informe financiero para aclarar qué sucedió con el dinero recolectado por los hondureños en Estados Unidos.

Según la denuncia interpuesta ante el Instituto de Acceso a la Información Pública (IAIP), el polémico periodista logró recolectar la cantidad de 106,730 dólares a través de la plataforma GoFundMe, bajo el título de "Honduras, Eta el pueblo salvando al pueblo". Sin embargo, las denuncias de los damnificados indican que no han recibido la ayuda y, por lo tanto, se vieron en la obligación de exigir un informe financiero y actividades a las personas encargadas de solicitar la colecta, entre ellas Milton Omar Ávila Benítez, sociólogo, politólogo y Máster en Ciencias Políticas.

Isahac Dubón reveló que el dinero fue entregado en su totalidad a Milton Benítez, quien es candidato independiente a la presidencia en las próximas elecciones generales del 28 de noviembre. Además, aseguró que enviaron 2.5 millones de lempiras (equivalentes a aproximadamente 100,000 dólares) hace aproximadamente 10 meses al programa "El Perro Amarillo", pero no han recibido una rendición de cuentas profesional. Dubón afirmó que se gastaron 13,000 dólares, pero Benítez aún sostiene que tiene 90,000 dólares en Estados Unidos.

Mariachis de Guadalajara, pertenecientes a la Conferencia Norte, se enfrentarán a un duro rival en su próximo encuentro por el principal campeonato de béisbol profesional de México. El noveno, dirigido por Benjamín Gil, logró una victoria de 6-3 en su última presentación por la LMB frente a los Algodoneros de Unión Laguna en el Estadio Panamericano.

Ahora que tenemos estos datos claros, es importante informar la fecha y hora exacta del próximo partido del equipo 'Mariachi' en la competición de béisbol más importante del país norteamericano. El horario del encuentro será a las 19:15 horas de Colombia, 20:15 horas de Miami, 21:15 horas de Buenos Aires y 19:15 horas de Guadalajara, México.

خلال مؤتمر القطاع المالي في العاصمة السعودية، أكد الجدعان تصميم بلاده على الوصول إلى الأهداف بشكل أسرع، مع تمكين القطاع الخاص من خلال تبسيط اللوائح. وأوضح أن الاستثمارات الأجنبية في السعودية تضاعفت خلال عام 2018، بينما ارتفعت الاستثمارات المباشرة بنحو 5 بالمائة.

وأضاف: "نعمل مع 18 وزارة لإزالة جميع العوائق أمام المستثمرين"، مشيرًا إلى أن وزارة المالية السعودية أطلقت مبادرة بقيمة 2.1 مليار ريال لدعم القطاع الخاص. كما أشار الوزير إلى أن الإيرادات غير النفطية زادت بأكثر من ثلاثة أضعاف خلال الربع الأول من عام 2019، موضحًا أن سياسة الحكومة السعودية أسهمت في خفض العجز ورفع كفاءة الإنفاق.

This paper explores the challenge of recovering a structured signal from a limited number of corrupted measurements, expressed by the equation:

\[ y = \Phi x + v + z \]

Here, Φ ∈ R^m×n is the sensing matrix, x ∈ R^n represents the structured signal to be estimated, v ∈ R^m denotes the structured corruption, and z ∈ R^m stands for unstructured observation noise. The goal is to estimate both x and v based on the given information of y and Φ. If v contains useful information, then this model can be viewed as a signal separation (or demixing) problem. Specifically, in the absence of corruption (v = 0), this model reduces to the standard compressed sensing problem. This problem is prevalent in various practical applications, such as face recognition, subspace clustering, sensor networks, latent variable modeling, principal component analysis, and source separation.

Theoretical studies in the literature have explored this problem under different scenarios, including sparse signal recovery from sparse corruption, low-rank matrix recovery from sparse corruption, and structured signal recovery from structured corruption.

Given the ill-posed nature of this problem, feasible recovery is achievable when both the signal and corruption exhibit suitable structures. Common examples of structured signals or corruptions include sparse vectors and low-rank matrices. Utilizing proper convex functions f(•) and g(•) to encourage structured signal and corruption, respectively, three prevalent convex optimization methods are employed for reconstruction based on available prior information.

When prior knowledge of either the signal f(x) or corruption g(v) along with the noise level δ (in terms of the L2 norm) is known, the following constrained convex recovery procedures are considered:

\[ \min_{x,v} f(x) + g(v) \quad \text{s.t.} \quad ||y - \Phi x - v||_2 \leq \delta \]

and

\[ \min_{x,v} f(x) + g(v) + \lambda ||y - \Phi x - v||_2 \]

In the case where only the noise level δ is given, the partially penalized convex recovery procedure is favored, represented as:

\[ \min_{x,v} ||y - \Phi x - v||_2 + \lambda(f(x) + g(v)) \]

where λ > 0 is a tradeoff parameter. When no prior knowledge is available, the fully penalized convex recovery procedure is applied:

\[ \min_{x,v} ||y - \Phi x - v||_2 + \lambda_1 f(x) + \lambda_2 g(v) \]

with τ_1, τ_2 > 0 as tradeoff parameters. Numerous numerical findings suggest the emergence of phase transitions in all three recovery procedures under random measurements.

An essential question that arises is how to accurately determine the phase transition locations.

Deep learning models have been instrumental in solving numerous real-world problems, even surpassing human-level performance in many tasks. However, these models typically require all training data to be available at the start of the training process. If this condition is not met, they are prone to catastrophic forgetting, where their performance on previously learned classes or tasks deteriorates. In contrast, humans have the ability to continually learn new data classes without losing previously acquired knowledge. To mitigate catastrophic forgetting, deep learning models should adopt lifelong, continual, or incremental learning strategies.

A significant challenge for deep learning models arises when all classes are not present in the training set. If the test set includes classes not seen during training, the model's performance declines markedly, leading to the zero-shot learning problem. This issue becomes even more daunting when combined with the incremental learning problem. In this paper, we address the task incremental learning problem in both zero-shot and non-zero-shot settings.

The task incremental learning problem involves training a model on one task at a time, with each task comprising a distinct set of non-overlapping classes. When a new task is introduced for training, the data from previous tasks is no longer accessible, causing the model to forget prior knowledge if trained only on the new task. Thus, the model must preserve the knowledge of older tasks while learning new ones. The task incremental generalized zero-shot learning problem extends this by involving classes that are unseen during training, akin to the zero-shot learning scenario. Here, the model's goal is to accurately recognize both seen and unseen classes across all trained tasks.

In our research, we conduct various experiments on the task incremental learning problem in both zero-shot and non-zero-shot contexts to demonstrate the effectiveness of our approach.

"Preparing to Fuse the Hydrogen"

"Do you think we should say something before we flip the switch? Like 'Eureka' or something?" 

"I've got that covered." 

I turned to face the room, filled with the greatest minds in the world. They looked up at me. 

"Creations of God, Creating God. Follow me to the new age." 

With that, I turned back to the console and flipped the switch. On the giant screen displaying the fusion reactor, a blinding light flashed. Everything started shaking, knocking people off balance. The room was filled with a light so bright that the pixels on the screen began burning. Soon, the screen went completely black with dead pixels. We started feeling the heat of the new sun through the thick heat shields separating the reactor from the initiation room. 

Minutes passed, each one feeling like years. Everyone was gripped with fear and uncertainty. After a couple of minutes, the heat subsided, and the rumbling stopped. 

"Launch backup cameras. Replace the screen. Come on, people, get moving!" 

Engineers quickly brought in a replacement screen and fixed the TV. The cameras turned on, revealing Sol II. We had successfully created a mini-sun. We were now the most important scientists of the new age. A deafening cheer rose from the scientists, each filled with joy and relief. We had saved humanity. 

After a night of celebration, I finally retired to my dorm in the UNMS (United Nations Moon Sector) facilities. As I went to brush my teeth, a smile on my face, I didn't notice at first. I walked out of the bathroom and into bed, and then it hit me. What had I just seen? I walked back into the bathroom and looked into the mirror. It was me, but as a burnt corpse in the initiation room. 

The corpse got up and looked at me. 

"Why?" 

I went to sleep, thinking it was just a hallucination. I woke up in the initiation room, the smell of charred bodies filling the air. I got up and saw a face that shook its head at me. This was God. I didn't know how I knew, but I did. 

"No."

The electronic health record (EHR) system has experienced rapid growth over the past decade. EHRs encompass patients' medical information, history, diagnoses, medications, treatment plans, and laboratory and test results. They automate and streamline workflow to aid healthcare providers in decision-making. With advances in machine learning, various deep learning techniques and frameworks have been applied to clinical applications, including information extraction, representation learning, outcome prediction, phenotyping, and de-identification. This study aims to develop a doctor recommendation system utilizing patients' EHR histories.

Existing studies employ different types of EHR code representations. Recently, Word2vec methods have gained popularity. In word-level vector representation methods, all possible meanings of a word are transformed into a single vector, overlooking the fact that words can represent different meanings in different contexts. To address this issue, Alsentzer et al. proposed the clinical BERT, a context-based model trained on all notes from MIMIC III, achieving state-of-the-art performance. Using these embedding methods, patients can be represented by a sequence of clinical service codes. Techniques range from autoencoders for diabetic nephropathy, CNNs for unplanned readmission prediction, LSTMs for heart failure prediction, and GRU networks for predicting mortality. However, in these studies, EHR data are treated as flat-structured information, ignoring the relationships among services, patients, and doctors. Regarding prediction tasks, few studies have explored using EHR data mining for doctor recommendations. Compared to treatment recommendations, doctor recommendations require more structured information due to factors such as specialty and patient preference. Therefore, a method that can learn underlying information from the hidden structure in EHR data is urgently needed for doctor recommendations.

Standard machine learning approaches necessitate centralizing training data on one machine or in a data center. However, collecting clinical datasets from isolated medical centers is impractical due to the sensitivity of clinical data, such as disease symptoms and medical records. In this context, federated learning (FL), which allows local client models to collaboratively learn a shared prediction model while keeping all training data private, eliminates the need to store data in the cloud. However, most existing FL works are limited to systems with i.i.d. datasets and centralized parameter servers. In reality, EHR data are fully decentralized among hospitals and non-i.i.d. due to geographic influences on human health. Nonetheless, each hospital can share de-identified, non-sensitive, and intermediate statistics with neighboring hospitals. This study proposes a federated decentralized learning approach to enhance client models' performance while meeting privacy requirements.

Our contributions are summarized as follows:
- We extract structured information from EHR data by constructing a heterogeneous graph with different types of nodes and edges.
- We propose a heterogeneous graph attention network (HGAT) that considers time sensitivity and node heterogeneity for representing patients, doctors, and services.

Mass was the same as ever today. I sat with my family in the back, resting on the ancient brickwood of the pew and tapping my fingers impatiently against the Holy Book of Destiny in my lap. My journal rested unused next to me, this sermon far too mismatched to take notes for anyway. I tapped my watch out of boredom, and its shimmering blue display emerged from a slit on the top. 11:24. I sighed at the unwanted revelation: the sermon had only been in progress for 9 minutes. I glanced sidelong at my family, trying not to attract attention to myself—the last thing I needed was Dad going off on me again for being distracted during church.

As usual, Dad's hand was going a mile a minute through his notebook, probably capturing every nuance of the priest's voice in his quaint, tiny cursive. His deep, brown eyes rarely left the priest, so I really had no idea how he was able to write like that. Better for him, I suppose. Mom was absently rubbing the bottoms of her shoes against the pew in front of us as she sifted through the Destiny, occasionally jotting down a bullet point in her journal. Funny, she'd probably warn me against rubbing my shoes like that; the church here was coming on 1700 years old, after all. Not a soul was allowed in the sanctuary any time other than morning service, and it scared me to think of the consequences of vandalism, accidental or not. My sister seemed just as bored as I was but had taken to drawing small doodles in the corners of her pages, some of the doodles even venturing into the Destiny itself.

Losing interest in their activities, I decided to focus back on the priest. Maybe his sermon was becoming a bit more organized by now…

He certainly seemed excited about whatever he was going on about, throwing his hands up as he proclaimed, "To Earth go the sinners in life, and to the mighty star Lucidum go those faithful to the Wanderers!" 

"Blessed!" called someone from the front of the church, an older man in sharp dress.

"May the Wanderers find us and save us!" The priest continued, raising his Book high so all the congregation could see its broken leather. "Let us open to book of Esa, chapter 1." He paused for a moment, taking a breath. "And this journey will be undertaken by thousands of men and women. Only the strongest, most able, most intelligent individuals will be selected to lead this journey to save the human race. Two massive ships shall set out and arrive in the orbit of Lucidum, and there find prosperous land to continue on survival of humanity, should they follow the detailed instruction within this book."

The priest set the book down and addressed the crowd.

Le 2 juin marquera-t-il la fin du couvre-feu en France ? Pour le prolonger au-delà de cette date, le gouvernement devrait également étendre le régime de l'état d'urgence sanitaire, prévu pour se terminer le 1er juin. Voici quelques explications.

Emmanuel Macron s'exprimera ce vendredi 30 avril pour dévoiler les grandes lignes de son calendrier de déconfinement progressif.

Première étape : dès ce lundi 3 mai, la fin de la limitation des déplacements à plus de 10 km de son domicile et de l'attestation de déplacement en journée.

En effet, mercredi, à l'issue du Conseil des ministres et du Conseil de défense sanitaire, Jean Castex a annoncé des évolutions dans l’arsenal législatif face à la crise sanitaire.

La première concerne le couvre-feu. Est-ce bientôt la fin du couvre-feu tel que nous le connaissons ?

Le régime d'urgence sanitaire actif jusqu'au 1er juin

La France est toujours sous le régime de l'état d'urgence sanitaire, qui expire le 1er juin. Pour prolonger le couvre-feu, il faudrait d'abord prolonger l'état d'urgence sanitaire. Ce n'est pas une mince affaire, d'autant plus qu'en février dernier, lors de la dernière prolongation, le projet de loi n'avait pas été adopté à une large majorité (278 voix pour, 193 contre).

Un régime transitoire à compter du 2 juin

Le chef du gouvernement a donc annoncé qu’il proposerait au Parlement "d’instituer un régime transitoire de sortie de crise sanitaire courant du 2 juin au 31 octobre prochain".

Objectif : "accompagner le processus de réouverture par des mesures adaptées à l’évolution de la situation".

Que pourrait-il se passer après le 2 juin ?

Conséquence directe, il ne sera donc pas possible "de recourir au couvre-feu tel que nous le connaissons aujourd’hui", a précisé le Premier ministre. Selon BFMTV, qui a contacté Matignon, à compter du 2 juin, seulement 10 % de la population française pourrait être soumise au couvre-feu.

Toutefois, un couvre-feu national pourrait être réinstauré si la situation sanitaire l’exigeait, mais seulement pour une durée d'un mois. Pour une période plus longue, le Parlement devrait à nouveau donner son aval.

Que peut faire ou ne pas faire l'exécutif ?

En revanche, le nouveau texte "permet au gouvernement, par décret, de fermer ou de maintenir fermés un certain nombre d’établissements recevant du public", a poursuivi le Premier ministre.

Élodie Gossuin sait comment bien commencer ses semaines chargées. En effet, cette maman comblée de deux paires de jumeaux, Jules et Rose (10 ans) ainsi que Joséphine et Léonard (4 ans), fruits de son amour avec Bertrand Lacherie, n'hésite jamais à offrir des câlins pour recharger ses batteries avant d'enchaîner ses rendez-vous professionnels. 

Le lundi 9 avril 2018, notre ancienne Miss France et Miss Europe 2001 a, par exemple, posé en serrant tendrement sa petite Joséphine contre elle. « Un sourire pour bien commencer la semaine #HappyLundi #1blondepeutencacheruneautre », a commenté Élodie Gossuin en légende de cette photo complice sur Instagram.

Bien entendu, les internautes ont été ravis de découvrir les visages rayonnants de ce duo mère-fille. « Quel bonheur de vous voir ! », « Je n'ai pas de mots, c'est tellement beau », « C'est une magnifique photo, une vraie tranche de vie », « Elle est trop chou, cette petite », pouvait-on lire parmi les premières réactions à la publication.

Pour rappel, Élodie Gossuin n'est pas du genre à chômer. Lorsqu'elle ne s'occupe pas de ses quatre enfants, soutenue indéfectiblement par son compagnon, l'ex-reine de beauté anime Le Meilleur des réveils sur RFM et multiplie les projets avec France 2. On l'a notamment vue, pleine d'énergie, aux côtés de Patrick Sébastien dans Les Années bonheur ce 7 avril, où elle animait un jeu téléphonique.

La ONU capacitará al personal público involucrado en la lucha contra el tráfico de armas en Paraguay, en el marco de un protocolo de cooperación firmado hoy por el ministro de Exteriores, Luis Castiglioni, y la Oficina de Desarme de las Naciones Unidas.

A través del acuerdo suscrito, la ONU proporcionará a Paraguay los medios técnicos necesarios para llevar a cabo dicha capacitación, mientras que el Ejecutivo paraguayo será el encargado de financiar la iniciativa, que "fortalecerá las capacidades" del país en el combate contra "este flagelo", afirmó Castiglioni.

Añadió que el acuerdo contribuirá "a la lucha contra el crimen transnacional y todos sus delitos conexos", una prioridad, dijo, para el Gobierno que preside Mario Abdo Benítez.

La representante interina de la ONU en Paraguay, Regina Castillo, destacó "la importancia" de que un país cuente con personal cualificado para enfrentar el desafío del tráfico ilegal de armas, "cuyas redes son cada día más sofisticadas y operan a través de fronteras porosas".

Castillo insistió en la relevancia de la cooperación entre las distintas entidades involucradas en el control del comercio de armas y aseguró que el acuerdo ayudará a "incrementar la seguridad de las personas, un pilar fundamental para el desarrollo de los derechos humanos".

También felicitó al Ejecutivo paraguayo "por comprometer fondos financieros y humanos" en esta lucha, lo que, a su entender, "demuestra que hay voluntad política" para prevenir el comercio ilícito de armas en Paraguay.

El protocolo firmado hoy desarrolla el Tratado sobre el Comercio de Armas, suscrito en 2014 por 130 países, entre ellos Paraguay, con el propósito de mejorar la regulación del comercio internacional de armas convencionales (desde una pistola hasta un buque de guerra) y combatir su tráfico ilícito.

El Tratado establece normas estrictas para el comercio de armamento convencional, tanto a nivel nacional como internacional.

En Paraguay, el mercado negro de armas mueve entre 100,000 y 700,000 objetos armamentísticos al año, frente a las 400,000 armas registradas de manera legal para uso civil, según datos del Centro de Estudios Judiciales correspondientes a 2016.

Attorney Jay McMahon is set to officially announce his candidacy for the Massachusetts State Senate in the Plymouth & Barnstable District on November 19. "After very serious deliberation and much encouragement, I will be formally announcing my candidacy for the state Senate," McMahon stated. "I believe our communities need strong leadership at the State House to address our unique issues. As the next senator, I am committed to being a fiscal watchdog for the taxpayers, tackling the opioid crisis, and leveraging my extensive experience to strengthen our criminal justice system to protect victims. My goal is to prioritize you, the hard-working people whom the State House has forgotten," added McMahon, a resident of Bourne.

Details of McMahon's formal announcement are as follows: 
- 2 p.m., November 19, at Plymouth Rock
- 4 p.m., November 19, at Falmouth by Town Hall
- Campaign Kickoff: 6-8 p.m., November 19, at Mezza Luna Restaurant, 253 Main St., Buzzards Bay

A lifelong resident of Cape Cod with over 30 years of combined experience in the legal, law enforcement, and military fields, McMahon asserts he is prepared to step in immediately for Sen. Vinny deMacedo, R-Plymouth, who is resigning to assume another role.

Throughout his career, McMahon has been a trial attorney, litigating cases at every level within the Massachusetts Court system, as well as in federal courts. His small business, located in Buzzards Bay, employs several local residents. Additionally, McMahon served in law enforcement during the 1970s and has over 12 years of corporate management experience.

McMahon also served as a lieutenant in the Military Police with the Massachusetts Army National Guard during the 1970s.

The use of this new technology to read emotions has a lot of potential for various applications. It can detect emotions accurately, even if someone is faking a smile or a frown. Employing this technology to assess the emotional expressions of students in a classroom is beneficial, as it can enhance their learning experience, make learning more enjoyable, and address any internal or external conflicts they may be facing.

This innovative technology has the capacity to positively impact numerous individuals, particularly students. By recognizing students' emotional states, teachers can gauge the overall mood of the class and offer support to uplift the students. Additionally, it can identify signs of stress or worry in students, enabling teachers to adjust their approach and provide appropriate guidance. It is akin to the notion that a person can interpret a friend's emotions by simply observing their facial expressions. If a teacher is aware of a student's stress or worry, they can adjust their teaching methods or deadlines accordingly.

This technology can transform students' learning experiences and can make the classroom a more engaging environment. If a student is disinterested or struggling in a particular subject, the technology can detect their emotions and alert the teacher, prompting adjustments to the lesson to better engage the student. This can lead to a more personalized and effective teaching approach, similar to the adaptability of a skilled human instructor, as the article highlights. 

Furthermore, the utilization of this technology to read emotional expressions can help identify students at risk of dangerous behavior, such as bullying, self-harm, or school shootings, and provide the necessary intervention. The ability to differentiate between a genuine and a forced smile can help to identify students in distress, potentially preventing harmful actions. 

In a broader context, the implementation of this technology can greatly benefit schools worldwide, revolutionizing the learning process, promoting student well-being, and preventing risky behaviors. If this technology is widely adopted, it has the potential to avert a multitude of negative incidents, such as bullying, shootings, and self-harm, and create a safer, more supportive educational environment.

Se vuelve a ofrecer AISA, el programa para que los recién llegados a Oiartzun hagan una primera aproximación al euskera y a la cultura vasca. Aisa es un curso ofrecido a adultos, impulsado desde la Comisión de Euskera de Oarsoaldea y sus ayuntamientos. La matrícula está abierta hasta el 19 de febrero, en el Servicio de Euskera (planta baja de Fermiñene; (943 49 38 42) o el euskaltegi Intxixu AEK (Fermiñene, 1ª planta; 943 49 39 57). 

En el caso de Oiartzun, los dinamizadores de las clases serán los profesores del euskaltegi Intxixu AEK. Las clases se impartirán desde el 26 de febrero al 22 de junio, 4 horas por semana.

Not only are deep neural networks like convolutional neural networks (CNNs) crucial for traditional AI tasks [6, 15], but their utilization in scientific fields is also on the rise [4, 20, 26]. Nevertheless, the demands for enhancing the inference performance of CNNs have remained unmet in recent years. Previous studies have taken various approaches to develop faster and more efficient CNNs, such as weight pruning [25], quantization [10, 18], and kernel factorization [34, 41].

Pruning techniques aim to eliminate weight redundancy to create a sparser model that reduces the computational costs and memory bandwidth required for inference. However, this necessitates specialized sparsity-aware accelerators, entailing significant efforts in designing and fabricating new hardware. Additionally, some researchers have suggested establishing a regular sparsity pattern through hardware-aware pruning algorithms [9, 25, 43], but the compression ratio is largely limited by the enforced sparsity patterns.

Quantization involves reducing the number of bits needed to store model weights but encounters two main challenges: (1) Quantized CNNs often require arbitrary precisions (e.g., 4-bit weights), while commonly used accelerators like GPUs only support a limited range of precisions (e.g., half precision). (2) The compression ratio achieved by quantization remains insufficient, particularly for many large CNN models.

In response to these limitations, recent studies on compressing CNN models have primarily focused on a novel direction of creating compact models using kernel factorization techniques such as matrix/tensor decomposition. Matrix/tensor decomposition can represent a large matrix/tensor by combining multiple smaller matrices/tensors, substantially reducing the number of required representation parameters. However, matrix decomposition involves converting high-order tensors into matrices and then conducting matrix decomposition, resulting in the loss of spatial information, whereas high-order tensor decomposition achieves higher accuracy [41]. Consequently, several compact CNN models have been developed using diverse tensor decomposition methods [11, 19, 39]. Among these endeavors, Tucker decomposition (TKD) [38] excels in minimal hardware modification support, ultra-high compression ratios, and lower accuracy loss for CNN acceleration.

We pinpoint three major challenges in accelerating TKD-compressed CNNs on cutting-edge GPUs:

1. Absence of hardware-aware TKD algorithms for CNN acceleration: The selection of Tucker ranks significantly impacts practical latency when the target hardware platform is chosen. Unfortunately, existing TKD compression methods [13, 19] determine ranks through laborious efforts or iterative searches, devoid of hardware awareness.

2. Lack of software-aware TKD convolution algorithms for CNN acceleration: While Tucker-based convolution decomposition can drastically reduce computation FLOPs by decreasing the input and output channels of the original convolution layer, realizing this reduction in FLOPs as an actual performance improvement, especially for small batch sizes like one, poses challenges. This is because Tucker-based convolutions underutilize resources when executed with existing software such as cuDNN.

3. Shortage of performance models for tuning tucker-format convolutions on GPUs: Common software for high-performance convolutions, like TVM, can generate quick convolution code by tuning hyperparameters through machine learning approaches on a set of convolution templates. However, these computation schemes may not work effectively for tucker-format convolutions on GPUs. Therefore, an analytical performance model is urgently required to guide parameter tuning for tucker-format convolutions on GPUs.

There is also a need for performance-driven frameworks to achieve highly efficient and accurate CNN inference on GPUs. Current model compression methods mainly focus on reducing FLOPs rather than actual runtime reduction. Designing an end-to-end compression framework that encompasses training highly accurate TKD-compressed models and developing optimized inference code to reach the optimal model size, beyond which further compression offers no performance gain, presents a challenge.

Bien que ralenti ces dernières années, le boulevard des Frères-Moga demeure une "autoroute urbaine". Cet axe majeur de sortie ou d'entrée de Bordeaux, situé au sud et sur la rive gauche de la Garonne, représentait une anomalie dans une métropole où la place de la voiture est de moins en moins privilégiée. Sa configuration en 2×2 voies (voire 2×3 à certains endroits) attire fortement les amateurs de vitesse ou tout simplement les conducteurs pressés...

（法新社华盛顿4日电）美国国会众议院今天首度表决通过大麻合法化，朝调整联邦法律以与某些州和国家一致，迈出了关键的一步。

民主党主导下的众议院以228对164票，轻易通过了大麻合法化法案；然而法案要在共和党掌控的参议院过关，机会不大。

该法案是要将大麻从联邦「管制药品法」（Controlled Substances Act）中剔除，这项法律将大麻与海洛因和古柯硷并列为危险毒品，罚则很重。

美国联邦政府将大麻列为管制药品，与许多州的作法不一；这些州已经将大麻药用合法化，其中诸如科罗拉多等州甚至全面解禁，开放大麻消遣用。

大麻合法化草案主要提案人之一、民主党籍众议员纳德勒（Jerry Nadler）说：「我们将大麻视为法律犯罪问题而非个人选择和公共卫生问题已经太久了。」

「各州（对大麻）日益认可显示，这个议题的现状让人难以接受。」

Spurious correlations are unintended associations or biases that models learn between input images and target labels. These often arise from factors such as data selection biases (Torralba and Efros, 2011; Jabri et al., 2016). The frequent co-occurrence of certain features, like foreground objects or backgrounds, with a higher than average likelihood, can lead models to focus on non-predictive, spuriously correlated features rather than the core predictive ones. ASPIRE, a novel method, automatically detects these non-predictive features for each class (e.g., indoor backgrounds for small dogs) and generates synthetic images without them (e.g., small dogs in an outdoor background). These new images can be added to the training set to develop a more robust image classifier. For example, in the ImageNet dataset (Deng et al., 2009), most images labeled as "Dog Sled" also feature a dog. Consequently, classifiers trained on ImageNet often fail to identify a dog sled without a dog.

Instances of a class in the training set with co-occurring spurious features are commonly known as majority groups. Conversely, atypical instances without these features are known as minority groups. Deep neural networks trained on such datasets generally perform poorly on minority groups due to their scarcity, leading to significant performance degradation in tests or real-world scenarios involving domain shifts (Sagawa et al., 2019; Arjovsky et al., 2019). Learning these correlations negatively impacts various Computer Vision (CV) applications, including visual question-answering (Liu et al., 2023c), retrieval (Kong et al., 2023; Kim et al., 2023), and classification (Liu et al., 2021a). Teaching deep neural networks to represent data meaningfully while avoiding over-reliance on spurious features remains a central challenge in CV.

During the training of over-parameterized deep neural networks, multiple solutions with the same loss values exist at any stage. The optimizer typically gravitates towards a solution with lesser complexity, often learning shortcuts (Wilson et al., 2017; Valle-Perez et al., 2018; Arpit et al., 2017; Kalimeris et al., 2019). When faced with co-occurring spurious features, the optimizer may prefer them since they usually require less complexity than the desired semantic signals (Bruna and Mallat, 2013; Bruna et al., 2015; Brendel and Bethge, 2019; Khani and Liang, 2021).

Developing classifiers robust to spurious correlations is an active research area (Sagawa* et al., 2020; Liu et al., 2021a; Kirichenko et al., 2023). Researchers often assume annotated data for minority groups exists within the training dataset. The prevailing principle is that improved generalization on minority groups can result in a more robust classifier. Despite extensive research indicating that more data can enhance generalization, little effort has been made to leverage this for building robust classifiers. It is impractical to manually collect and label minority group images for large-scale datasets. In complex datasets like Hard ImageNet, beyond CelebA (Liu et al., 2015) and Waterbirds (Welinder et al., 2010), a single class may have multiple spuriously correlated features.

As time progresses, so does the advent of new technology. A significant development in this modern era is computer-driven cars. This progression has inevitably raised the question: should we embrace them or not? While computer-driven cars may pose issues of responsibility during accidents, they ultimately promise a higher degree of safety and convenience for society. Therefore, it is necessary for them to be implemented and to redefine driving as we know it today.

Computer-driven or "driverless" cars undoubtedly offer more safety for both drivers and pedestrians compared to traditional human-operated vehicles. Currently, a diverse range of individuals enjoy the privilege of driving, including the elderly, young people, and those with disabilities. Although this accessibility seems beneficial, it can lead to potential disasters; young drivers are more prone to drive under the influence of drugs or alcohol, while older or disabled drivers may be less aware on the road. With driverless cars' emergence, individuals who may not excel at driving can rely on minimal personal involvement to reach their destinations. For instance, BMW announced its development of Traffic Jam Assistant—a system that manages driving functions at speeds up to 25 mph—and these driverless cars can even steer, accelerate, and brake autonomously. Furthermore, features such as flashing lights on windshields and other heads-up displays are being considered. With these innovations combined any type of driver would benefit simply because they no longer need to handle most aspects of driving themselves; this would inevitably lead to increased safety in society since careless mistakes by both drivers and pedestrians could be significantly reduced.

In addition to enhancing road safety for everyone involved driverless cars also offer substantial convenience benefits., As mentioned earlier Google's co-founder Sergey Brin envisions a future where fleets form public-transport taxi systems comprised entirely out autonomous vehicles.. In overpopulated countries like China today's transportation congestion has reached such extremes that car owners face restrictions limiting their ability use roads certain days week., However,, through implementing system offering guaranteed access daily rides population gains relief from constraints while simultaneously benefiting environmental groups activists alike due improvements fuel efficiency flexibility compared buses highlighted paragraph one.. Consequently,, protecting environment becomes intrinsic phenomenon thanks introduction widespread adoption autonomous automobiles..

L’annonce de la disponibilité des anciens vaccins contre le Covid-19 a redonné espoir à des centaines de millions de personnes menacées par la pandémie et la crise économique qui en a résulté. Pour accéder aux résultats communiqués ces jours-ci par les laboratoires pharmaceutiques, la contribution de milliers de bénévoles qui ont accepté de participer à des expériences spéciales visant à vérifier l’efficacité des composés est essentielle. De nos jours, certains de ces participants se tournent vers les plateformes sociales telles que TikTok pour raconter leur expérience des tests.

C’est le cas, par exemple, d’Ashley Locke, une Américaine de 29 ans originaire du Tennessee qui a participé à l’expérimentation mise en place par Oxford-AstraZeneca pour son composé AZD1222. Elle l’a annoncé à ses followers sur TikTok avec une vidéo la montrant sur le chemin de la clinique où elle était sur le point de recevoir sa première injection. La vidéo a suscité l’intérêt de centaines de milliers de personnes, si bien que la jeune femme a ensuite lancé une série de contenus dans lesquels elle proposait des mises à jour sur sa santé et sur le processus de contrôle mis en place par les fabricants de vaccins. Locke n’a pas hésité à répondre aux questions des followers avec des TikToks appropriés, et elle n'a pas non plus reculé face aux antivaccinistes et aux négationnistes qui continuent de comparer le Covid-19 à une grippe commune.

À quelques centaines de kilomètres de là, en Géorgie, une autre jeune femme de 29 ans, Chelsea Regina, suit le même chemin, mais avec un autre vaccin: celui de Pfizer.

Hello, I am Luke, and I joined the Seagoing Cowboys program. I am here to convince you to join it, too. While there are both good and bad experiences on board, they are just a part of a normal day for me.

The reason I joined is that it is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity. The first reason I think you should join is the incredible sights you get to see. For example, I once marveled at the Panama Canal on my way to China and got to see an excavated castle in Crete. You don’t get to see castles and marvel at the engineering of the Panama Canal every day.

Life on the ship is filled with fun and games. We use the animals’ stalls to play games, such as volleyball, baseball, and table tennis. We also engage in activities like boxing, fencing, reading, and whittling. It's a fun and exciting time on the boat, and you get to bond with the crew and the animals.

However, the journey isn't without its risks. On one of my nine trips, I, more than anyone, had a close call. I was the watchman, and I was checking the crates, the way I normally do, when, one rainy night, I reported the news to the captain. As I was coming down the ladder, I slipped, and, to my horror, I shot, feet first, toward the ship's edge.

"Seagoing Cowboys" are individuals responsible for caring for horses, young cows, and mules being transported overseas. Becoming a Seagoing Cowboy is a life-changing experience, driven by three compelling reasons: the opportunity to visit breathtaking locations, contributing to a noble cause, and the enjoyable experiences the job offers. Let's explore each of these reasons further. First, let's delve into the aspect of beautiful places.

The primary reason to consider becoming a Seagoing Cowboy is the chance to explore stunning locations. As a Seagoing Cowboy, you can travel through Europe, aiding communities, and uncovering the beauty of places like Venice, Italy, with its captivating gondola rides, or the historic Acropolis in Greece. Along the journey, you may stumble upon unexpected scenic gems, such as the Panama Canal, en route to destinations like China. This allure of discovering remarkable places stands as the initial, compelling reason to embrace the role of a Seagoing Cowboy. Next, let's explore the second, equally important, reason.

Another pivotal reason to become a Seagoing Cowboy is the opportunity to support a meaningful cause. The impacts of war can, at times, necessitate the relocation of animals, making the role of the Seagoing Cowboy, in the preservation of the well-being of these animals, of the utmost importance.

(德国之声中文网) 《法兰克福汇报》发表的“北京的足迹”一文关注了周六天问一号探测器成功着陆火星的消息。作者注意到，在探测器着陆的那一刻，中国国家航天局指挥中心并没有出现狂热的激动，反而中国的科学家们“全神贯注地完成这项行星际跨越的任务，体现了中国的崛起”。中国国家主席习近平对此赞扬道：“这是我国航天事业发展的又一具有里程碑意义的进展。”

“尽管美国航天局早在1976年就将飞行器送至火星表面并成功着陆，1997年再次发射了一个电脑大小的火星车并成功登陆，随后向地球传回了数百张红色星球的图片。然而，中国科学家值得骄傲的是，美国用了几十年才做到的事情，中国在相对较短的时间内不仅实现了，而且在同一次飞行任务中同时完成了环绕和着陆火星。”

以中国上古神话中的火神命名的“祝融”火星车将探索火星上是否存在生命，“中国不愿将这一问题的答案拱手让给美国航天局以及美国火星探险家、特斯拉亿万富翁马斯克。成功着陆不仅为中国在世界上赢得了荣誉，也展现了研究火星的坚定意志。早在2019年，中国就在青海省投资1.5亿元建设的火星模拟基地开幕时，这一意志就已表现得淋漓尽致。”

中国的飞跃

“中国希望在今后15年内成为全球生产、运输以及服务的中心，并将制定经济运作的标准。假如西方在同一时期止步不前，可能最终只能沦为经济殖民地。”

德国《世界报》在周一（5月17日）刊登的“中国开始飞跃”一文中用以上文字作为提要。文章开头写道：

“3年前，中国宣布为了建立覆盖全球的互联网，需要在2020年底前发射60颗人造卫星。去年秋季，中国更进一步细化了计划，宣布这个网络需要12992颗卫星。”

“中国的科技部门与生产部门合作，将打造全球6G通信网络。今年7月，两颗试验卫星将被送入轨道。从物理上看，使用6G网的起步条件比5G更复杂，但中国相信，到2030年后，6G不仅可以在技术上被定义，而且甚至可以达到商业使用的水平。

You see the Earth, and she is falling, languid and sharp, breathing and short of breath, heaving and still, and still falling. Within the pits, the dark forever of your eyelids hides the twitching, roiling black planets inside a blue sky surrounded by a white nothing, and no matter how rapidly they move, still, they cannot see. But the images are inescapable, the fire, the smog, the tears so hot they steam and fog your eyelids, the red, the yellow, and the blackened shell, that's everything left in the world.

Après une légère baisse jeudi, le nombre de malades du Covid-19 en réanimation est reparti à la hausse vendredi, dépassant 5 750 patients, selon les chiffres quotidiens de Santé publique France. Parmi les 5 757 patients Covid en services de soins critiques (réa, soins intensifs, surveillance continue), 498 ont été admis ces dernières 24 heures. Cet indicateur très surveillé se rapproche ainsi encore un peu du pic de la première vague (un peu plus de 7 000 patients début avril 2020). Le pic de la deuxième vague (un peu plus de 4 900 patients en réa mi-novembre) avait lui été dépassé fin mars.

La pression sur les services hospitaliers en général est toujours très élevée avec désormais 30 326 malades Covid à l'hôpital (dont 2 120 admissions en 24 heures), un chiffre en légère baisse par rapport à jeudi. En 24 heures, 301 nouveaux décès ont été enregistrés dans les établissements hospitaliers, pour un total de 98 395 morts depuis le début de l'épidémie (dont 72 271 à l'hôpital). Le ministre de la Santé Olivier Véran a estimé vendredi que la pression sur les réanimations continuerait «encore à monter pendant au moins 15 jours».

Le nombre de nouveaux cas enregistrés en 24 heures s'élève à 41 243. Le taux de positivité, pourcentage de personnes contaminées parmi celles qui sont testées, est en hausse à 7,8% sur les 7 derniers jours. Plus de 500 000 vaccinations ont été réalisées ce vendredi.

立委拟参选人吴佩蓉日前对照韩国瑜政治献金支出明细，指出韩国瑜膳宿费高达94万元以上，其中一笔4万多的帐目，疑似住过台北万豪饭店的总统套房。吴佩蓉质疑这与韩市长主打庶民形象不符。韩办今天下午发表声明，要求吴佩蓉三天内公开道歉，否则提告。

对此，国民党北市立委参选人孙大千在脸书上指出，东西不要乱吃，话更不应该乱说。说出来的，就要有承担的勇气。

La Conselleria de Cultura informa que la muestra, coordinada e impulsada por el Consorci de Museus, tiene como objetivo reconocer la figura del pintor alicantino especializado en el retrato al pastel. Vicente Rodes retrató a la burguesía valenciana y catalana de comienzos del siglo XIX.

La exposición ha sido comisariada por los profesores Sergio Pascual y Pilar Tébar, quienes reflejan en el discurso expositivo la investigación realizada. La muestra comenzó en el Museu de Belles Arts de Castelló en 2018, luego se trasladó al Museo de Valls de Tarragona y desde junio pasado se encuentra en el Museo de Bellas Artes de València. Próximamente, continuará su itinerancia en el Museo de Bellas Artes de Alicante durante el mes de octubre.

Cada sede de la exposición incorpora nuevas obras, como dibujos preparatorios y pasteles, así como documentación aportada por la familia. Esto permite ofrecer un estudio y una presentación muy completa de toda la trayectoria del artista.

En la muestra de València, se destacó la incorporación del retrato del general Francisco Javier Castaños de Vicente López. Este retrato demuestra la consideración y el reconocimiento que tuvo Vicente Rodes en su época, ya que el general español también fue retratado por él años antes.

Esta exposición es la más importante dedicada a Vicente Rodes hasta el momento. Muestra la calidad de su obra y su relación e influencia en el devenir histórico de València y Barcelona en aquella época.

Affaire Sweet Beauté : Face-à-face houleux entre Sonko et le Doyen des juges

Hier, Ousmane Sonko a été entendu par le Doyen des juges concernant l'affaire de "viols et menaces de mort" dans laquelle il est accusé par la masseuse Adji Sarr. Dès la lecture des incriminations par le magistrat instructeur, le leader de Pastef a lancé les hostilités en déclarant: «Je ne fais pas confiance à la justice et je ne vous fais pas confiance. La justice protège des gens épinglés par les rapports des corps de contrôle. Des gens qui ont détourné», a-t-il dit au juge qui est resté calme. Rapporte Libération dans sa parution du jour, Sonko a poursuivi ses diatribes dans une ambiance lourde en martelant : «Je suis victime d'un odieux complot», en citant des noms.

Suite à la plainte du leader de Pastef, le juge lui a signifié qu'il est placé sous contrôle judiciaire avec trois conditions : interdiction de quitter le territoire sans autorisation, obligation de se rendre dans le bureau du juge chaque mois, et interdiction de commenter publiquement l'affaire Sweet Beauté.

Cédric O à l'Élysée, le 15 janvier 2020 à Paris (AFP / Ludovic Marin)

Le secrétaire d'État au numérique, Cédric O, s'est déclaré mardi "optimiste mais pas totalement certain" quant à l'utilité du projet d'application pour smartphones StopCovid dans la lutte contre le coronavirus, devant la commission des affaires économiques du Sénat. 

L'application StopCovid, si elle est déployée, a pour objectif de prévenir l'utilisateur en cas de contact avec une personne contaminée par le virus. Son principe repose sur le stockage, pendant une durée déterminée, des identifiants de tous les smartphones équipés de l'application détectés à proximité, grâce à la technologie Bluetooth.

Cependant, Cédric O a expliqué aux sénateurs que la technologie Bluetooth ne permet pas de mesurer précisément la distance entre deux smartphones, rendant incertaine l'évaluation du risque réel de contamination entre les porteurs des appareils.

"C'est l'objet d'un travail très intense que nous menons avec les Allemands, qui ont une légère avance sur nous mais qui ont partagé leur expertise", a-t-il précisé. "Réussirons-nous à obtenir quelque chose de suffisamment précis pour atteindre notre objectif épidémiologique ? Je suis optimiste mais pas totalement certain", a-t-il ajouté.

Google et Apple, qui contrôlent les deux principaux systèmes d'exploitation de smartphones, ont annoncé vendredi qu'ils collaboraient pour faciliter la mise en œuvre de telles applications. Cependant, "ils n'ont pas expliqué exactement ce qu'ils envisagent", a indiqué Cédric O. "Toute aide peut être bienvenue (...) mais elle doit se faire aux conditions des gouvernements concernés", a-t-il averti.

Le projet est engagé dans une course contre la montre, tant sur le plan technique que politique, car l'application doit être prête et soumise à l'avis du Parlement avant le 11 mai, date prévue pour une sortie progressive du confinement.
