El grupo de Unidos Podemos en el Congreso, junto con ERC, PDeCAT, PNV y parte del grupo mixto (Compromís, Bildu y Nueva Canaria), ha registrado hoy dos proposiciones de ley para modificar la Ley de Amnistía y el Código Penal con el fin de investigar los crímenes del franquismo y reparar a las víctimas.

Uno de los textos propone cambiar el artículo 9 de la Ley de Amnistía de 1977, añadiendo que "las disposiciones contenidas en esta ley no impedirán que los juzgados y tribunales investiguen, enjuicien o impongan las penas correspondientes a las personas responsables de haber cometido delitos de genocidio, lesa humanidad, delitos de guerra y otras graves violaciones de derechos humanos".

La otra proposición prevé añadir al artículo 2 del Código Penal un texto que detalla que no se impedirá "el castigo de una acción u omisión" que en el momento de su comisión constituyera ese tipo de delitos, "según la costumbre internacional y los principios generales del derecho reconocidos por las naciones civilizadas que conforman la comunidad internacional".

Los proponentes han lamentado que el PSOE, con el que han trabajado en este ámbito, finalmente se haya desmarcado de ambas proposiciones de ley, aunque han confiado en que las apoye en la Cámara y, por tanto, salgan adelante.

El portavoz de ERC en el Congreso, Joan Tardà, y el de En Comú Podem, Xavier Domènech, han sido dos de los diputados que han registrado las proposiciones en nombre de Unidos Podemos-En Comú Podem-En Marea, Compromís, PDeCAT, PNV, Bildu y Nueva Canaria.

A continuación, han salido a la Puerta de los Leones junto a representantes de colectivos como la Coordinadora Estatal de Apoyo a la Querella Argentina Contra Crímenes del Franquismo, cuyo responsable, José Galante, ha agradecido el respaldo a sus demandas.

Ha añadido que la ley de amnistía de la Transición no fue tal, sino más bien "una ley de punto final" que hay que cambiar para "juzgar los crímenes y considerar que los crímenes contra la humanidad no pueden ser amnistiados, en virtud de los tratados internacionales firmados por España".

También ha defendido la necesidad de incorporar en el Código Penal la figura de la imprescriptibilidad de los delitos relacionados con crímenes contra la humanidad, con el objetivo en ambos casos de que se tramiten las querellas interpuestas por diferentes ayuntamientos "para que se reconozca el derecho de la justicia a las víctimas de la dictadura".

El portavoz de En Comú Podem, Xavier Domènech, ha sostenido que "la ley de amnistía se convirtió en una ley de punto final" y que, tras 40 años, es hora de cambiarla porque "no se pueden amnistiar los delitos de lesa humanidad" y es necesario "cumplir los estándares internacionales".

Su homólogo en ERC, Joan Tardà, ha dicho que "el rebrote del franquismo, del nazismo y la banalización de los crímenes contra la humanidad están directamente relacionados con la impunidad" y que hoy España está "indefensa ante esa banalización porque no ha metabolizado el pasado, no se ha reparado a las víctimas, no se ha juzgado a los verdugos y no se ha hecho lo que sí han hecho otras sociedades con pasado fascista".

En la misma línea se han pronunciado Jordi Cluxat, del PDeCAT; Enric Bataller, de Compromís; Yolanda Díaz, de En Marea; Sara Carreño, de Unidos Podemos, y Marian Beitialarrangoitia, de EH Bildu.

Sus declaraciones han coincidido en la Puerta de los Leones con una protesta de unos veinte afectados de Fórum-Afinsa, que gritaban contra la "intervención ilegal" de esa entidad y la pérdida de su dinero.

Según las proyecciones del informe LEO (Loyola Economic Outlook) correspondiente a la primavera, la economía andaluza crecerá un 2,1% en 2019 y la tasa de desempleo se situará en el 21,2%. Se espera que el crecimiento para la economía andaluza sea una décima inferior al 2,2% de la economía española, y que en 2020 el crecimiento sea similar al nacional, en torno al 2%.

En cuanto al mercado laboral, se espera que la economía andaluza continúe generando empleo con un dinamismo moderado. Según el informe, el crecimiento del número de ocupados podría situarse en el 2,1% este año y en el 1,8% en 2020. Estos incrementos en el empleo contribuirán a la disminución de la tasa de desempleo, que se espera que oscile en torno al 21,2% en 2019, frente al 23,0% de 2018.

Los indicadores adelantados del LEO estiman que el primer trimestre de 2019 podría haber terminado con un crecimiento del 0,6%, en línea con el PIB nacional. Para el segundo trimestre de 2019, se estima que el PIB podría crecer una décima menos, en torno al 0,5%.

En el año 2020, se espera que la tasa de desempleo se sitúe en torno al 19,8%, siendo el primer año que se baje del umbral del 20% desde 2008. Aunque la disminución del desempleo en Andalucía parece ser más importante que en el resto de España, la región aún mantiene un diferencial de desempleo elevado de 7,7 puntos porcentuales, que podría reducirse a 7,1 en 2020, según las estimaciones del informe.

En cuanto al nivel de precios, se espera que experimente incrementos en línea con el dato nacional, aunque ligeramente por debajo. En 2019, se estima que el IPC en Andalucía crecerá en torno al 1,3%, mientras que en 2020 podría hacerlo en un 1,4%.

En cuanto a la economía española, el LEO señala que el crecimiento del año 2018 fue el primero por debajo del 3,0% desde 2014. Las dinámicas proteccionistas y la desaceleración de la economía global se traducirán en una mayor moderación del ritmo de crecimiento económico de la economía española en los próximos dos años. Sin embargo, el informe descarta la existencia de un riesgo significativo de recesión en ese horizonte.

El informe LEO cree que la economía española sigue manteniendo un buen tono en el inicio del año 2019 y que la actividad económica registrará un crecimiento sólido en la primera mitad del año.

The scene was unlike anything I had ever witnessed. The wind tore branches from trees and shingles from rooftops, scattering them noisily onto the street like a child in the throes of a tantrum. That's when the Laytons' house caught fire.

Poor Layton had purchased it only a year ago, unaware of what had happened to the previous tenant, thanks to the agent's omission. What a disaster.

To his credit, Layton was always urging the Davies to keep their trees trimmed, but Andrew Davies was not one to take action. By the time the fire department arrived, the entire south side of the street was engulfed in flames, including my own house. Smoke hung in thick clouds above my bed. When I looked out the window, I saw red and gold shadows flickering everywhere.

I must have still been groggy because I don't remember how I ended up downstairs.

A crowd had gathered in front of the Davies' house. Andrew emerged, carrying his daughter, her head limp over his sweaty arms. I moved to help him, but the firefighters were shouting for everyone to stay back.

At the edge of the crowd, a man was laughing. His ears were dirty, his brow smudged with grime—it was difficult to find a clean spot on him. I didn't recognize him, but I had no trouble shooting him a stern look.

Our eyes met, and his grin faded. I turned back to the burning houses, listening to the crackle of the flames. A wave of almost *comforting* heat washed over me. For a brief moment, I considered stepping closer to the fire until another firefighter emerged—

From *my* house.

He carried a woman over his shoulder, running and coughing up smoke like a chimney. She wasn't breathing much at all.

A suppressed giggle came from the man. 

"What is *wrong* with you?" I whispered, "Can't you see how serious this is?"

"I can see just fine, thank you!" he replied cheerfully. "But can *you*?"

"What on *Earth* are you talking about?" I asked, trying to meet his gaze with a hard stare. His face was an eerie purple and blue in the firelight. At least, I assumed the firelight was responsible for the colors. I couldn't quite place him, but I was *certain* I had seen him before.

He smiled, and with my brow furrowed, I asked, "Have we met?"

"Yes, we have. And unfortunately, we are meeting again."

*Well, that's just rude,* I thought. I gave him a proper harumph and turned away.

He didn't take the hint. He pointed over my shoulder at the firefighter carrying the woman from my house. "Don't you know that woman?"

His voice had a teasing lilt, and I could hear laughter creeping back into it.

"No," I said, "It must be one of the neighbors. The Lanes, maybe..." I paused. The Lanes didn't have a daughter that old. "Or... the Stevens..."

A strangled sound escaped from the dirt-covered man behind me. I turned to see him nearly *exploding* with laughter.

For the second time that night, I asked, "What is *wrong* with you?

Dani Pedrosa (Honda) sorprendió a todos sus rivales al ser el más rápido de la primera jornada de entrenamientos libres para el Gran Premio de la República Checa, que este fin de semana se disputa en Brno. Pedrosa, que por la mañana sólo pudo ser séptimo, sorprendió al convertirse en el más rápido de la jornada, tras bajar su propio récord del trazado, que estableció en 2014 con un registro de 1.56,027, con lo que desbancó a los favoritos.

El catalán marcó un mejor tiempo de 1.55,976, con el que superó en 123 milésimas a Danilo Petrucci (Ducati), segundo en discordia, y a Álvaro Bautista (Ducati), empeñado en demostrar que aún tiene un hueco en MotoGP.

Energy communities are increasingly recognized as a solution for enhancing system efficiency, achieving economies of scale, and promoting equity. They facilitate the aggregation of distributed energy resources (DER) and broaden technology access [1]-[3]. An illustrative example of a generic energy community is shown in Fig. 1. Here, a group of customers form a coalition, pooling and aggregating their resources. This community engages in energy and monetary transactions with a utility company as a single entity, operating behind a point of common coupling (PCC) downstream of the utility revenue meter [3]. 

Under the widely adopted Net Energy Metering (NEM) policy, the utility revenue meter assesses the community's net consumption. It assigns a buy (retail) rate if the community is a net importer of energy, and a sell (export) rate if the community is a net exporter [4]. Several utilities have implemented programs to enable energy communities, such as NEM aggregation (NEMA) for university campuses, residential complexes, and medical cities.

In this work, we focus on the pricing mechanism that determines the payment for each community member, based on their consumption, individually owned renewable energy, and their share of the community-owned DER.

Twenty-five years ago, NASA discovered a face on Cydonia, Mars. The face was extraordinary, resembling an Egyptian face. Many people speculated that it was a human face created by aliens, but as a scientist at NASA, I can confirm that it is not. NASA conducted a thorough investigation of the "Face," aiming to debunk the theory of extraterrestrial involvement.

Upon closer examination, it was revealed that the face was just another Martian mesa, a common occurrence in Cydonia. Despite the face gaining popularity in various media, including movies, magazines, radio shows, and books, NASA was determined to provide conclusive evidence. In 2001, NASA captured a closer, clearer image of the face, dispelling the illusion that it had eyes, a mouth, and a nose, thus debunking the belief that it was a face, rather than a natural landform.

أطلقت السلطات الأمريكية أمس الإثنين سراح متعاقدة سابقة مع وكالة الأمن القومي الأمريكي، كشفت عن تقرير "سري للغاية" بشأن القرصنة الروسية المزعومة خلال الانتخابات الرئاسية الأمريكية عام 2016، وذلك قبل انتهاء مدة عقوبتها، بحسب ما أفادت صحيفة "ذي غارديان" البريطانية.

وذكر موقع قناة "الحرة" أن رياليتي وينر، الموظفة السابقة في شركة متعاقدة مع وكالة الأمن القومي، قد حُكم عليها في عام 2018 بالسجن لمدة 5 أعوام و3 أشهر. إلا أنها خرجت من السجن بسبب "حسن السلوك"، وفقاً لما صرحت به محاميتها، أليسون غرينتر ألين.

وأضافت ألين أن وينر لا تزال ممنوعة من الإدلاء بتصريحات علنية، وطلبت هي وعائلتها الخصوصية "خلال فترة التعافي من صدمة السجن".

وقد أُدينت وينر بتهمة تسريب تقرير سري، وكانت أول شخص وُجهت له إدارة ترامب الاتهام بموجب قانون التجسس بتسريب وثيقة.

The Man finished up his song, sat silently at the piano for a few seconds, then reached into his jacket for his flask. He brought it to his lips, attempted to take a swig, then upended it to watch the last few drops fall to the floor.

The Man turned to look at a man dressed in a slightly disheveled white suit. His lips cracked into a slight grin. "Hello, Stan. It's been a long time."

Stan sat on the bench next to the Man, motioning the barkeep to bring a few drinks over as he did so. "Come now, you know my real name. Why insist on calling me Stan?"

"I like Stan better than Satan. It's close enough, and causes less of a terrified reaction if someone overhears me." The man was silent as the barkeep placed two glasses of ice on the piano, and watched as he poured some scotch into both. Stan followed the barkeep's retreating form as the Man reached for his drink.

"Poor sap, he prays every day for something or someone to take him away from here."

The Man swirled his drink for a moment before replying, "He should know that God isn't listening. That's why I turned to you." He sipped his drink.

"I think the man upstairs is listening, he just doesn't interfere. I, on the other hand, love seeing what you people can do if I give you the chance. You, for instance. I gave you the ability to make music worthy of the gods, and so you did."

The Man stared into his drink, as though it held some deep secret he longed to understand. "So I did."

Stan sighed and reached for his drink. "It's a shame, really, what happened to your family. I swear to you, I had nothing to do with it."

"I know you didn't. It's not your style." The Man said, still staring into his glass.

"No, it isn't. Dying due to a drunk who decided to get behind the wheel.... There's nothing elegant about that, nothing honorable, nothing poetic. I am truly sorry that it had to happen to you."

"Could you have saved them?"

Stan sipped his drink before answering. "Could I have saved them? No. No, my abilities aren't quite as all-encompassing as that, unfortunately." He sipped his drink again. "Just like I can't save you."

The Man turned to face Stan, comprehension dawning on his face. "That's why you're here?"

"Yes, but not in the way you're thinking. I'm not going to collect your soul, that wasn't part of our deal. You see, you're going to die tonight. Aneurysm. You'll die in your sleep, painlessly. If you went to the hospital right now, they might be able to save you. But you won't."

The Man turned back to his drink. "You're right, I won't."

"A shame. You could have been so much more if things had been different." Stan turned to the piano, stretching his hands. "I came here to play with you one last time. To show these people what could have been. If we're lucky, maybe our music will inspire them to great heights. I know for damned sure that they'll never forget it."

The Man grinned, raising his glass to Stan, who did the same. "To old friends."

"To damned good music."

With that, they drained their drinks and started to play. The devil played slowly, giving the Man a smooth bass line to play to. The Man listened for a moment, then began to play a somber piece that meshed perfectly with the devil's music. Together, they played for a few minutes, filling the bar with their music. Then, together, they began to sing, playing the whole time.

In order to bring a vehicle to market, car manufacturers must obtain prior authorization from the relevant authority. This is granted after demonstrating that the vehicle meets all applicable regulatory standards and safety certification requirements. Whether through vehicle type approval or self-certification, Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) must undergo rigorous certification processes to validate a component, a system, or the entire vehicle.

Traditionally, vehicles are certified using classical methods, involving physical certification tests conducted on test tracks or benches to assess the necessary safety levels based on various performance criteria. These methods are suitable for components, systems, and vehicles with limited complexity and minimal interactions with other entities, such as in braking tests. However, as system complexity increases (for example, with Electronic Stability Control), classical methods fall short in covering all relevant safety areas. This is due to two main reasons. First, the multitude of safety-related systems, including numerous electrical and electronic systems, increases the risk of systematic and random hardware failures. These issues are generally addressed by existing functional safety and Automotive Safety Integrity Levels (ASIL) requirements in the automotive industry, like ISO 26262. Second, the vast variability of potential multi-agent scenarios necessitates a formal safety model and has led to the adoption of simulation-based safety audits to complement physical vehicle testing.

The introduction of assisted (SAE Levels 1 and 2), automated (SAE Level 3), and autonomous (SAE Levels 4 and 5) driving systems further complicates matters, with increased software functions, multi-agent scenario variants, interactions, and potentially impacted safety areas. The complexity and testing difficulty of these systems grow with the level of automation, especially significant in the transition from SAE Level 3 to 4. Here, the automated driving system must achieve a minimal risk condition within its Operational Design Domain (ODD) without user or passenger intervention.

Innovative testing approaches are required for future vehicle safety regulatory frameworks and assessments under current exemption procedures. New online and in-service safety monitoring and verification mechanisms, which come into play after the market deployment of automated driving systems, are also necessary to reduce the need for testing all possible combinations during type approval. Numerous national and international regulatory and standardization initiatives and projects are already addressing these challenges.

One of the most robust regulatory proposals is being developed by the Working Party on Automated/Autonomous and Connected Vehicles (GRVA) of the UNECE World Forum for Harmonization of Vehicle Regulations (WP.29). It is based on three pillars that must be assessed together. Firstly, audit and assessment involve the use of simulations to cover all types of scenarios, particularly edge cases that are rare in real-world traffic. Secondly, physical certification tests assess critical scenarios in controlled environments on test tracks, utilizing sophisticated equipment such as lightweight global vehicle targets, articulated pedestrian targets, and bicyclist targets. Finally, real-world test drives are conceived as a "driving license test" for automated driving systems, evaluating the vehicle's overall capabilities and behavior in non-simulated traffic on public or open roads. This approach has been adopted by the UN to regulate the approval of Advanced Emergency Braking Systems (AEBS) and more recently, Automated Lane Keeping Systems (ALKS). These regulations have been integrated into countries such as Japan and Germany, facilitating the commercialization of the first SAE Level 3 automated driving systems by two different car manufacturers.

A similar approach was put forward by the PEGASUS project, which included laboratory, simulation, testing site tests, and field tests, with a focus on defining use cases and test scenarios. Another project, ENABLE-S3, aimed to reduce traditional road testing efforts by emphasizing virtualization. A key contribution was the use of semi-virtual systems like the DrivingCube, which combines simulation with ready-to-drive vehicles on a chassis dynamometer and a power-train testbed. This method serves as an intermediate step between pure simulation-based verification and physical certification testing, or as a subfield of simulation using vehicle-in-the-loop (VIL).

The three approaches mentioned—simulation (including VIL simulation), physical, and real-world testing—have their strengths and weaknesses, making it crucial to implement them holistically. As shown in Table I, these methods are somewhat complementary. Simulation-based testing offers full controllability, repeatability, and variability efficiently but lacks fidelity and real-world behaviors. Increasing fidelity comes at the cost of increased complexity, reducing efficiency from VIL simulation to physical testing on closed tracks.

In predictive modeling, the primary goal is to identify a relationship between matrices X and Y, each with N rows representing individual samples. The matrix X consists of K columns, each representing a predictor of the samples, while the matrix Y includes M columns representing observations. Instead of directly utilizing X and Y, certain models compute the matrix products, XᵀX and XᵀY, to facilitate the modeling process.

Our work introduces three innovative algorithms designed to significantly accelerate cross-validation, which requires the computation of XᵀX and XᵀY for each dataset partition. These algorithms are capable of rapidly computing partition-wise, potentially mean-centered, and optionally sample standard deviation-scaled XᵀX and XᵀY. Importantly, they avoid the need for recomputing the full XᵀX and XᵀY for each training set, and they do not necessitate the recomputation of statistical moments, thus, preventing data leakage from the validation sets.

Given a graph \( G = (V, E) \), where \( V \) represents the set of nodes and \( E \subseteq V \times V \) denotes the set of edges, let \( Y \) be the node label vector, where each component \( y_v \) represents the label of node \( v \). Additionally, let \( X \in \mathbb{R}^{|V| \times d} \) be the node feature matrix, where each row \( X_v \) corresponds to a \( d \)-dimensional feature vector for node \( v \).

Edge prediction involves determining whether an edge exists between two nodes in a graph, using the features of the nodes and their neighbors. This task has numerous applications, such as predicting future friendships or connections in social networks, suggesting potential links between users and products or content in recommendation systems, and identifying undiscovered protein-protein interactions or potential disease associations in biological networks. Node classification, on the other hand, aims to predict the label of a node in a graph and is a popular task in machine learning with graph-based data.

Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) are designed to learn from and predict patterns in graph data. They are particularly effective because they can capture the structural information of graphs, making them ideal for predicting potential connections between nodes. While GNNs have been extensively studied for node and graph classification, their application in edge prediction has received comparatively less attention, presenting ample research opportunities. Edge prediction is notably more challenging, as it requires the model to understand complex relationships between nodes.

There are various approaches to edge prediction using GNNs. Three primary categories include Graph Autoencoder-Based (GAE) methods, subgraph neural graph networks, and techniques utilizing neighborhood node embeddings after Message Passing Neural Network (MPNN) operations. We will discuss each of these in detail.

Graph Autoencoders (GAEs) offer a powerful and flexible approach to predicting missing or future edges in a graph. GAEs operate by training a neural network to learn a latent representation of the graph, which is then used to reconstruct it. This involves training a graph autoencoder to generate node embeddings, followed by predicting edges in the reconstructed graph. However, GAEs have limitations in predicting dependencies between two endpoints of an edge, which can hinder their performance in simple scenarios (see [1] for more details).

To overcome the limitations of GAEs, subgraph neural network methods have emerged as a promising new approach to edge prediction. These methods focus on learning representations of subgraphs—small neighborhoods of nodes within the graph. The subgraph representations are then used to predict the existence of edges. One of the most successful methods in this category is SEAL (Learning from Subgraphs, Embeddings, and Attributes for Link Prediction) [7].

Despite the success of learning-from-subgraph approaches on standard datasets, they have some drawbacks. Calculating subgraphs for each edge is computationally expensive and time-consuming, especially in large networks. Additionally, the variable size of these subgraphs can reduce the efficiency of GPU-based training. Researchers have introduced innovative approaches to address these computational challenges (see [9], [10], and [11]).

Traditional methods for edge prediction typically learn node representations using a message-passing algorithm and then apply a predefined scoring function (e.g., the dot product of two node embeddings or a more complex function like logistic regression) to predict edge existence based on these representations.

There is minimal evidence to support the notion that the Face on Mars was created by aliens. However, there is substantial evidence suggesting that the Face is nothing more than a natural landform. Similar landforms can be found on Earth, and high-quality images have been captured showing a typical geological feature on the surface of Mars.

One key reason why we can confidently conclude that the Face was not crafted by extraterrestrial beings lies in its resemblance to Earth's landforms. The Face closely resembles mesas, which are common in regions like the American West. Jim Garvin, NASA's chief scientist for the Mars Exploration Program, highlighted these similarities: "It reminds me most of Middle Butte in the Snake River Plain of Idaho... That's a lava dome forming an isolated mesa roughly similar in height to the Face on Mars." The uncanny resemblance between the Face and known natural formations on Earth strongly suggests that it too is a product of natural geological processes.

Furthermore, advancements in imaging technology have provided clearer views of this enigmatic structure since 1976. In 1998, during a flyby over Cydonia where the Face is situated, researchers led by Michael Malin and his Mars Orbiter Camera team captured an image ten times sharper than earlier ones. This higher resolution image revealed no signs of artificial manipulation but rather showcased a typical geological feature. Subsequent photos taken with improved resolution further dispelled any lingering doubts about alien involvement.

Despite these findings, skeptics remained unconvinced and hypothesized that obscured "alien markings" may have been masked by atmospheric conditions such as haze or clouds. However, subsequent observations made during clear weather conditions using advanced imaging techniques discredited such claims entirely.

中国大陆国家副主席王岐山昨日在瑞士达沃斯论坛上发表讲话，呼吁各国尊重主权，避免技术霸权和干涉他国内政，倡导坚持多边主义，构建和平安全的国际环境。（美联社）

在论坛上，王岐山指出，解决经济全球化所带来的问题，必须对症下药。只有在扩大经济蛋糕的过程中，才能找到更好的分配方法，停止无休止的争吵和相互指责无助于解决问题。他强调，中美经济互相依存的现实已是既定事实，互利共赢是唯一的出路，两国合作则两利，冲突则两败。

**解决经济全球化需对症下药**

王岐山强调，经济全球化过程中产生的问题，需要通过适当的措施加以解决。发展不平衡的问题应通过积极的结构性改革来解决，国家要把握公平与效率之间的关系，采取有效政策防止收入分配失衡的加剧，并应对新技术和市场竞争对某些行业的冲击，让民众能从发展中受益。

王岐山指出，在扩大经济蛋糕的过程中，必须找到更好的分配方法，停止无休止的争吵和相互指责无助于解决问题。

**中美贸易问题及中国经济前景**

谈到中美贸易问题及中国经济前景，王岐山表示，美国国务卿蓬佩奥此前通过视频在大会上发表讲话，对中美贸易前景表示乐观，而他本人对此更为乐观。他强调，中美经济互相依存的现实已是不争的事实，互利共赢是唯一的出路，两国合作则两利，冲突则两败。

王岐山指出，中国经济去年增长6.6%，尽管面临各种风险和挑战，中国在2020年实现全面小康社会的目标不但能够达成，甚至会超出预期，这已是不争的事实。

In Ankara, Turkey, on May 5, 2016, Turkish Prime Minister Ahmet Davutoglu announced his decision to step down during a news conference at his ruling AK Party headquarters. This decision has raised concerns among German politicians about the future of Turkish governance, primarily due to the potential increase in President Tayipp Erdogan’s power.

Davutoglu is perceived in Europe as the more liberal face of the Turkish government. In contrast, Erdogan is heavily focused on establishing a powerful executive presidency, which critics argue could lead Turkey, an EU candidate, toward authoritarianism. Davutoglu had played a crucial role in negotiating a deal with Brussels to stem the flow of illegal migrants to Europe, a key factor that German Chancellor Angela Merkel hopes will bolster support for her conservatives ahead of a federal election next year.

Politicians from Germany's ruling coalition expressed their concerns on Thursday about the implications of Davutoglu's departure. Niels Annen, the Social Democrats' spokesman on foreign affairs, part of Merkel's coalition, told Reuters, "Erdogan will be able to push ahead with his plans to change the constitution now without opposition from his own ranks." He added, "In view of the prevailing climate of repression and the current debate about lifting the immunity of opposition lawmakers, this is bad news."

Erdogan's ruling AK Party has faced criticism for backtracking on media freedoms. It also aims to remove lawmakers' immunity from prosecution, a move seen as targeting a pro-Kurdish party in the Turkish parliament. Juergen Hardt, the foreign affairs spokesman for Merkel's conservatives, also expressed concern about Davutoglu's departure, stating, "Turkey will decide itself whether its future path leads to Europe or towards greater isolation."

German politicians have long followed Turkish affairs closely due to the significant Turkish community in Germany and the countries' trade relations. Germany, home to around three million people of ethnic Turkish background, is a vital trade partner for Turkey. The EU migrant deal with Turkey has been Davutoglu's project, yet Erdogan, frequently critical of the 28-nation bloc, has sometimes appeared to belittle his progress.

The migration issue remains a pressing concern for Germany.

شكرًا لكم على قراءة خبر حول الري ومشروع الانتقال من نظم الري بالغمر إلى الري الحديث في الوادي والدلتا. يتم الآن عرض تفاصيل الخبر.

في القاهرة، اجتمعت الدكتورة إيمان سيد، رئيس القطاع، لمناقشة أهم نتائج وتوصيات الدراسة الفنية لمشروع الانتقال إلى نظم الري الحديث في الأراضي القديمة بالوادي والدلتا، التي يعد قطاع التخطيط لها بالتعاون مع فريق الاستشاريين في مشروع EU Water STARS.

وأكدت إيمان سيد على ضرورة التنسيق مع خبراء البنك الدولي لتنفيذ التوصيات الناتجة عن دراسة الاتحاد الأوروبي، بهدف تأمين أفضل الحلول التقنية والتمويلية لتوسيع نظم الري الحديث في أراضي الدلتا. يأتي ذلك في إطار دراسة مشروع الانتقال إلى نظم الري الحديث في الأراضي القديمة بالوادي والدلتا، التي يعد قطاع التخطيط بالتعاون مع فريق الاستشاريين في مشروع EU Water STARS.

وقد أعلن المهندس عبد اللطيف خالد، رئيس مصلحة الري، فرض غرامة على المخالفين الذين يبذلون مياه بشكل غير قانوني للأراضي المقرر تحويلها إلى نظم ري حديثة. سيتم تطبيق العقوبة ابتداءً من العام القادم 2021، مع منحهم مهلة لتصحيح وضعهم واعتماد الري الحديث.

من جهته، أوضح الدكتور إبراهيم محمود، رئيس قطاع الري، في تصريحات سابقة، أن هناك اهتمامًا من الفلاحين بتنفيذ الري الحديث، خاصة مع الدعم المقدم من الوزارة بتوفير الخامات بقيمة تصل إلى 5000 جنيه للفدان والتعامل بدون فوائد على مدى سنتين.

وأوضح رئيس قطاع تطوير الري أن وزارة الري تعمل على تطوير نظام الري الحقلي، بهدف تحسين استخدام المياه وزيادة إنتاجية المحاصيل، وأشار إلى وجود مشروعات تجريبية لتنفيذ شبكات الري الحديث بنظام الرش والتنقيط في مناطق تجريبية.

وأضاف محمود أن استخدام الطاقة الشمسية في تشغيل أنظمة الري الحديث يساهم في خفض تكاليف الإنتاج الزراعي، كما أن هناك مشروعات تطوير تمولها صناديق التطوير والصيانة، وأشار إلى إجمالي الأعمال المنفذة خلال عام 2019 بقيمة 80 مليون جنيه، حيث شملت تطوير مسارات المياه على ترعة وادي عبادي في محافظة الأقصر وتطوير مسارات المياه في منطقة الوسط والمنايفة ومنطقة سيلا في محافظة كفر الشيخ ومنطقة سيلا المنطقة الأولى في محافظة الفيوم، وشملت أيضا توصيل الكهرباء لتغذية محطات المياه المطورة في منطقة مرزوق الثانية في محافظة المنيا، بالإضافة إلى مناطق تجريبية لأنظمة الري الحديث بالرش والتنقيط في محافظة الفيوم، وتكوين مجموعات للمشاركة في إدارة المياه.

Taylor Swift is heading to Australia to perform at the “race that stops a nation,” with the pop superstar strutting her stuff before the Melbourne Cup, organisers announced today. The Grammy Award-winner will sing two songs from her latest hit album Lover before witnessing the famous horse race that has been run on the first Tuesday of November since 1876.

The Victoria Racing Club made the announcement on social media, saying it was “super excited” about Swift’s one-off public appearance in Australia following the new album release. VRC chief executive Neil Wilson told national broadcaster ABC it was a strategic choice to target a younger demographic. “We’re targeting more and more of the next generation coming through,” he said of the event that is so important that race day is a public holiday in the state of Victoria. Swift’s appearance is expected to spark a rush for tickets from music fans as well as the usual Flemington race course punters.

Taylor Swift poses upon arriving for the Time 100 Gala celebrating Time magazine’s 100 most influential people in the world in New York on April 23, 2019.

由黄德斌、MIRROR成员吕爵安（Edan）和卢瀚霆（Anson Lo）主演的ViuTV剧集《大叔的爱》，作为首部本地制作的BL电视剧备受关注，让不少观众在观看过程中乐不可支。然而，也有观众发现该剧出现了一个巨大的漏洞！

在第四集开始的一幕中，由简慕华饰演的角色"Francesca"为了找到一个适合的内应来对付小三，阅读了地产公司分行员工的履历。这时，电视荧幕显示，由Edan饰演的角色"阿田"在2018年中文大学中文系毕业后立即加入了地产公司担任地产助理，而在第三集中，"KK"黄德斌却表示自己认识Edan已经有十年的时间。难道他们两个人早在2011年就认识了？这明显造成了时间线上的矛盾。

点击下图查看矛盾证据：

可能有观众认为"阿田"刚加入地产公司并签下第一份合同时，是以兼职工读身份工作。然而，根据地产代理监管局的网页显示，申请地产代理（个人）牌照或营业员牌照的人必须年满18岁。

Si vous connaissez bien la ville de Moscou, la découverte de ces bâtiments rappelant l'architecture médiévale européenne sera une véritable révélation. Les véritables édifices médiévaux de Moscou ont rarement survécu en raison des incendies récurrents. À la fin du XIXe et au début du XXe siècle, la ville a connu un essor urbain marqué par la construction d'usines, d'églises et d'immeubles selon des plans originaux. Les architectes ont puisé leur inspiration dans la vieille Europe pour transformer les manoirs de marchands en châteaux gothiques.

Dans l'Est de Moscou, se trouve l'usine Elektrozavod construite en 1915. Initialement prévue pour la production de galoches en caoutchouc et de pneus de voiture, elle arbore un style pseudo-gothique avec ses tours et flèches. Bien que le chantier ait été abandonné suite à la Révolution de 1917, l'usine a été achevée en 1925-1928 pour devenir un géant industriel soviétique.

La Cathédrale de l'Immaculée-Conception de la Sainte Vierge Marie, plus grande cathédrale catholique de Russie, a été édifiée entre 1901 et 1911 dans un style néo-gothique. Située au centre de Moscou, elle accueille des services religieux en plusieurs langues et est un lieu prisé pour les concerts d'orgue.

Le bâtiment de la pharmacie Ferreïn, construit à la fin des années 1890 dans un style classique de la Renaissance, cache une façade surprenante en briques rouges évoquant un château gothique. De même, le manoir de Savva Morozov, érigé dans le style néo-gothique anglais, évoque un château ancien et sert aujourd'hui de lieu de réceptions pour le ministère des Affaires étrangères.

Les Bains Sandouny, créés en 1808, se trouvent dans un bâtiment gothique des années 1890. Les intérieurs néo-gothiques rivalisent avec ceux des plus somptueux manoirs et sont ouverts aux visiteurs à la recherche d'une expérience de sauna russe authentique.

Le TSOUM, acronyme de « Magasin central universel », est l'un des centres commerciaux les plus prestigieux de Moscou. Construit en 1908 par deux marchands écossais, il conserve son aspect élégant rappelant une cathédrale, avec une rosace caractéristique.

Le musée théâtral d'État A. Bakhrouchine, édifié en 1894 dans un style gothique anglais, abrite toujours la collection de costumes et décors de théâtre du marchand Alexeï Bakhrouchine. Enfin, le château d'eau de la gare Ougrechenskaïa, semblant tout droit sorti d'un château médiéval, est désormais un site du patrimoine culturel de Moscou.

Ces bâtiments emblématiques de Moscou, aux inspirations médiévales et gothiques, témoignent du riche patrimoine architectural de la ville.

Desde el domingo, dos grandes buques no han podido ingresar al Puerto de Barranquilla debido a los fuertes vientos que alcanzan los 60 kilómetros por hora y al intenso oleaje de hasta tres metros de altura.

Los dos buques tienen un calado superior a los 9.0 metros; uno de ellos transporta 30.000 toneladas y el otro más de 25.000 toneladas. Entre los productos que traen se encuentran granos.

Lea también: Capturan a alias “El Menor” por el asesinato de un tendero en Barranquilla.

“Esperamos que las condiciones sean óptimas en las próximas horas para que estos buques puedan ingresar a la zona portuaria de Barranquilla”, manifestó el Capitán del Puerto, Carlos Urbano.

Debido a las fuertes brisas, se han tomado medidas preventivas que incluyen el monitoreo permanente de las condiciones meteorológicas en la zona portuaria y la supervisión de los buques que están programados para ingresar al puerto.

A Bedminster man who admitted to engaging in inappropriate online behavior with a child is awaiting sentencing. Michael Rendell, 36, of Wedmore Vale, appeared at Bristol Crown Court on June 8, 2018, where he pleaded guilty to several charges, including causing or inciting a child under the age of 16 to engage in sexual activity between December 2015 and December 2016.

Rendell had previously admitted to additional charges, including taking indecent photos of a child between June 2016 and March 2017, as well as making indecent images of children between October 2016 and March 2017. These images consisted of 31 in Category A (the most serious level of abuse), 93 in Category B, and 2,067 in Category C.

Judge Martin Picton, who presided over the case, adjourned sentencing to allow for further assessments. He ordered a probation report and psychiatric evaluation to better understand Rendell's background before deciding on the final punishment. "These are serious offences, but the court needs to know a lot more about you before final disposal," Judge Picton stated.

In the meantime, Rendell was released on bail under the condition that he fully cooperates with the probation service.

新竹市近日完成了「传产专案」移工筛检，全部748名参与者的结果均为阴性。（图／记者陈凯力翻摄）

记者陈凯力／新竹报导

为满足企业对移工快速筛检的需求，考虑到新竹市的许多传统产业是竹科的支援型产业链，并雇用了外籍移工，新竹市政府自6月12日起与竹市医师公会合作，启动「竹市传产专案」。市府主动通知辖区内的传统产业企业，提供「到厂筛检」服务。截至6月24日，共为12家有意愿的企业进行服务，筛检748名移工，结果全部为阴性。

为防止疫情影响企业运营，市府此前已启动「竹科专案」，筛检了竹科的5000名移工，以及「竹南专案」，筛检了超过100位竹南厂的从业人员。由于新竹市的传统产业是竹科的支援型产业链，移工是企业的重要生产人力，市府主动邀请各厂商为移工进行筛检，并与竹市医师公会组成医护团队赴厂采检。专案启动13天以来，共有12家企业提出需求，总计筛检748名移工。

市府表示，香山工业区雇用的移工总数约有2000人，为避免企业发生群聚感染从而影响产能，市府通过「竹市传产专案」主动出击，邀请有意愿的企业报名筛检。希望通过此举找出潜在的感染源，阻断隐形传播链，防止感染源进入社区，以便让企业能够安心持续经营。

The author is determined to explore Venus, despite the numerous dangers involved. It seems that the author maintains a strong opinion in favor of continuing exploration of Venus, downplaying the risks while proposing the use of technology to gather more information about the planet.

Venus, being the most Earth-like planet in our solar system, warrants further study regarding its characteristics and potential hazards for human exploration. If an astronaut were to venture there, ensuring their safety should be paramount; without adequate precautions, they may never return home to share their discoveries with loved ones. Rather than solely emphasizing Venus as a worthy pursuit despite its dangers, efforts should be focused on understanding and mitigating those risks through innovation and protective measures.

The author piqued my interest by mentioning the creation of a machine for exploration—a concept I strongly support. However, it was disconcerting when they mentioned that explorers would still need to remain at least thirty-plus miles above ground level even with such technology in place. This statement underscores how perilous venturing to Venus remains, as evidenced by the absence of manned missions there for over three decades.

In conclusion, while I believe that the author's arguments lacked full support for his ideas, I appreciate his creative thinking in exploring various solutions during his research on reaching Venus.

（法新社柏林16日电） 德国国会议员今天凌晨达成一项得来不易的碳定价（carbon pricing）折衷协议，打破政府气候政策改革所陷入的僵局。

德国国会今天凌晨结束6小时漫长会议，决议企业自2021年1月起，每用一公吨碳的额度须缴付25欧元（新台币840元）。这项费率是最初提议的两倍以上。

新费率遭到企业游说团体反对，预计到2025年以前还将调涨至每公吨55欧元，最终再与全欧洲联盟（EU）的碳交易体系进行整合。

梅克尔政府自9月提出最新气候方案后便遭受批评。环保非政府组织（NGO）与反对党主张这套方案缺乏企图心。

在野的绿党共同主席贝尔伯克（Annalena Baerbock）也说，在今天取得突破之后，仍需要「更多更多」突破。

德国国会今天的突破令人重新燃起希望，总理梅克尔（Angela Merkel）政府或许可以在耶诞节前通过由4部分组成的气候改革方案。

这套方案也包括降低铁路票价、调高空中交通税金等措施，上月大体上已获得国会两院支持。但新政策成本仍存在争议，法案特定内容遭阻挡，迫使政府与各邦重新协商。

Thomas Haung developed a groundbreaking technology known as the Facial Action Coding System. This system begins by having the computer construct a 3-D model of the human face, ensuring that all 44 major muscles in the model move in the same way as human muscles.

In my opinion, this system is incredibly useful because it allows us to recognize the full range of emotions someone is experiencing. While traditional methods may only allow us to perceive one or two emotions at a time, this system enables the identification of all the emotions present. Even if a person is attempting to conceal their feelings, the system can still detect them, making it a revolutionary invention that deserves widespread attention.

I strongly believe that the Facial Action Coding System should be implemented in schools. During the school day, it can assist teachers in understanding how their students are feeling. According to the passage, a teacher highlights the system's ability to recognize when a student is confused or bored, which can be invaluable in the educational environment.

Robotic surgery has been increasingly and widely adopted due to its significant advantages of flexibility and dexterity. A key area of recent research is the automation of surgical tasks. Embodied AI is a powerful method enabling surgical robots to autonomously learn and make decisions by perceiving and understanding their environment. Typically, policies for these robots are trained in simulators rather than the real world because Embodied AI algorithms require millions of interactions with the environment. Conducting these interactions in the real world can be time-consuming, expensive, and risky.

A good simulated environment is crucial for effective policy learning. However, integrating physically based soft body simulation into surgical robot simulation platforms is challenging. Physically based simulation algorithms are complex, as they involve knowledge about continuum mechanics, making them more intricate than rigid body simulations. Despite the challenges, advancements have been made. For instance, the first open-source reinforcement learning environment, dVRL, developed for surgical robots, only supports rigid body simulation. Xu et al. proposed SurRoL, a dVRK-compatible platform, also limited in this regard. Other simulators, like the Asynchronous Multi-Body Framework, and UnityFlexML, have been developed, utilizing the Bullet Physics library and NVIDIA FleX, respectively, for simulating deformable objects. These, however, rely on the position-based dynamics, which, while fast, lack the physical interpretability, as they are not derived from physical rules.

شكرا لقراءتكم خبر عن درجات الحرارة المتوقعة اليوم الثلاثاء 15/10/2019 بمحافظات مصر والعواصم العربية. الآن مع تفاصيل الخبر:

يتوقع خبراء هيئة الأرصاد الجوية أن يسود البلاد، اليوم الثلاثاء، طقس معتدل على السواحل الغربية، مائل للحرارة على السواحل الشرقية، ومائل للحرارة على الوجه البحري. ومن المتوقع أن تشهد القاهرة حرارة جنوبية نهارًا، ولطيفة ليلا. ومن المحتمل أن تقل الرؤية في الشبورة المائية صباحا على مناطق من شمال البلاد.

وتتوقع ظهور السحب المنخفضة والمتوسطة على أغلب الأنحاء مصحوبة بسقوط أمطار على مناطق في سيناء وخليج السويس وجنوب البلاد وسلاسل جبال البحر الأحمر. قد تكون هذه الأمطار غزيرة ورعدية أحيانًا وتصل إلى حد السيول في بعض المناطق. قد تمتد هذه الأمطار بشكل خفيف إلى القاهرة. وتكون الرياح في الغالب شمالية غربية معتدلة، وتنشط على جنوب الصعيد، مع انشطارها على خليج السويس مما يسبب اضطرابًا في الملاحة البحرية هناك.

أما بالنسبة لحالة البحر المتوسط، فستكون خفيفة إلى معتدلة مع ارتفاع للموج من متر إلى متر ونصف المتر، وتكون الرياح السطحية شمالية غربية. وبالنسبة لحالة البحر الأحمر، فستكون معتدلة مع ارتفاع للموج من متر ونصف المتر إلى مترين، وتكون الرياح السطحية شمالية غربية.

Près de cinq années d'étude, de longues analyses et de nombreuses démarches administratives ont été nécessaires pour enfin obtenir cette bonne nouvelle au Roeulx. Le ministre wallon des pouvoirs locaux, Christophe Collignon, a signé l’arrêté qui reconnaît officiellement le périmètre de rénovation urbaine du quartier du centre du Roeulx.

La rénovation urbaine est une opération d’initiative communale, qui vise à restructurer, assainir ou réhabiliter un périmètre, à améliorer l’habitat existant, et à renforcer les dynamiques socio-économiques et culturelles. C'est dans cet esprit qu'un bureau indépendant a d'ores et déjà réalisé une cinquantaine de fiches projets proposant les travaux à réaliser dans le centre-ville au cours des années à venir.

La reconnaissance officielle de la Région wallonne permettra l’introduction des demandes pour l’obtention de subsides régionaux afin de réaliser les manœuvres programmées. Dont certaines sont déjà reprises dans le Plan stratégique transversal de la commune.

Ces différents projets pourront voir le jour, petit à petit, dans les prochaines années.

La collecte de la Banque Alimentaire a commencé ce vendredi matin dans 300 magasins en Gironde. Dans certains supermarchés, il est possible de récupérer et de payer en caisse un sac déjà rempli de denrées. C'est la nouveauté de cette collecte 2017 en Gironde. Ce vendredi matin à Auchan-Lac, les clients peuvent récupérer en magasin des sacs déjà remplis d'une valeur de 5, 7 ou 10 euros, représentant 2, 3 ou 4 repas complets. Les sacs sont distribués par les bénévoles en gilet orange autour d'un îlot où le magasin propose des promotions sur les denrées recherchées par la Banque Alimentaire, telles que les pâtes, le riz et les conserves.

Il est important de ne pas hésiter à donner des pâtes, un produit toujours nécessaire. Les grandes surfaces ne reversent généralement pas ce type de produit non périssable aux associations, comme l'explique Pierrette Castagné, chargée de communication à la Banque Alimentaire 33.

Les 130 000 bénévoles de la Banque Alimentaire sont déployés dans 8 000 supermarchés français jusqu'à samedi soir. L'objectif des bénévoles en gilet orange est de collecter 12 000 tonnes de denrées non périssables, équivalant à 24 millions de repas, pour venir en aide aux 9 millions de Français vivant sous le seuil de pauvreté.

Have you ever wondered how cars might be upgraded? Just like phones, which are enhanced every year to much acclaim, cars too have the potential to evolve. However, after reading the article "Driverless Cars Are Coming," I am skeptical about the necessity of future car upgrades. Such advancements could have negative impacts, potentially leading to fatalities, changes in laws, and the transformation of driving practices.

In the first paragraph, Sergey Brin envisions a future with a public transportation system comprised of fleets of driverless cars, operating as a kind of public transit taxi service. He claims that these cars would use half the fuel of today's taxis and offer more flexibility than buses, potentially transforming the world. However, I am not convinced that they would have a positive impact. Instead, I foresee consequences, such as increased risk, fatalities, and danger, if such cars are invented.

In paragraph seven, the article states that cars are designed to alert drivers when the road ahead requires human skills, like navigating through work zones and around accidents.

Harry stepped outside with his pint and breathed deep the crisp autumn Oxfordian air. *A beautiful night*, he thought, as he stared up into the deep expanse above, twinkling with stars.

"Do - do you want to learn about astronomy, farmer?" A voice and a chuckle came from one of the tables laid on the street. Harry turned politely to face his addresser. Sat at the table, cloaked in black, were two young men, chuckling to one another and passing cheap wine between them. A flash of irritation hit him as he realized who addressed him; that most obnoxious of sub-species, *students*.

"*I said*... would you like to learn about astronomy, farmer? After all, you *are* ignorant of the majesty of the heavens." A blank look, which swapped to an obsequious smile, appeared on Harry's face as he worked out his response.

"Oh yes, zur," he started, his accent slipping to a mimicry of his father's. "Oh yes, I would loike to learn about the ztars. Oi've alwayz wondered about them, but never got no learning. No zur." The students grinned, and one took a breath to begin his patronizing lecture. "Well, you see..."

"After all, zur," Harry interrupted, "it's not loike, as a farmer, Oi learnt to read the skoi to know the zeasons, or the weather. Now, moi brother, *he* knowz the skoi. A sailor, see?" The two lads looked nonplussed.

El personal de la COMAPA de Reynosa reparó el emisor de 24 pulgadas de diámetro de la Estación de Bombeo de Aguas Residuales (EBAR) número 22 en la colonia Puerta del Sol, lo que permitió restablecer el bombeo. Para controlar el derrame, se instalaron abrazaderas especiales en el tramo de tubería que fue reparada. El cárcamo 22 tiene una capacidad de 250 litros por segundo y está conectado a la Planta Tratadora de Aguas Residuales número 2, ubicada también en Puerta del Sol. Esta estación de rebombeo recoge los residuos sanitarios de las colonias y maquiladoras en el lado oeste de la ciudad. La coordinación entre los departamentos de Agua Potable y Electromecánica de la COMAPA fue fundamental para restablecer el emisor PVC a presión de la Estación de Bombeo de Aguas Residuales a la Planta Tratadora de Aguas Residuales. Afortunadamente, las colonias del sector poniente de la ciudad no se vieron afectadas durante los trabajos en la estación de bombeo.

Programmable Logic Controllers (PLCs) are widely utilized in industrial automation, including safety systems at CERN. The improper functioning of PLC control system logic can lead to substantial financial losses due to property damage, harm to the environment, or, in extreme cases, injuries. Therefore, ensuring their proper operation is paramount.

Although testing has long been the conventional method for validating PLC control system logic, it is often inadequate as the sole verification approach. Testing, even when automated, cannot be exhaustive and thus cannot ensure the accuracy of the logic. Certain types of requirements, such as safety (ensuring that an unsafe state can never be reached) or invariants (formulas that must hold true under all system runs), are challenging, if not impossible, to test.

Model checking is a formal verification technique that complements testing activities to fully validate and verify PLC control system logic. It evaluates the satisfaction of formalized requirements on a mathematical model of the system being analyzed, checking for satisfaction across all input combinations and execution traces. Furthermore, if a violation is detected, a trace leading to the violation is provided.

The Google company is exploring innovative ways to captivate people with a self-driving car.

Wouldn't it be fantastic to sit in the driver's seat, enjoying music or reading a magazine, while your new Toyota handles all the driving for you?

One argument for driverless cars is their inclusion of rotating sensors, which can prevent accidents caused by the driver and offer financial benefits.

Driverless cars can sense and interact with the external environment, enhancing productivity and safety.

Various companies have utilized advanced technologies, such as magnets and sensors, to create a driverless car that can adapt to its surroundings.

Driverless cars can also prevent major accidents by using touch sensors and other safety features to alert and assist the driver when necessary.

The financial viability of driverless cars is a key consideration, with increased interest potentially leading to significant financial gains for companies.

Companies like Audi and Nissan are already planning to introduce autonomous cars, highlighting the growing trend and potential for the driverless car market.

In conclusion, driverless cars, with their advanced sensors and safety features, financial benefits, and market potential, are poised to revolutionize the automotive industry and enhance the driving experience for consumers.

Exploring Venus may not be the best approach to determining how similar it is to Earth, particularly regarding its potential to support life and agriculture. The risks are significant, and the endeavor can be extremely dangerous.

In the article "The Challenge of Exploring Venus," the author refers to Venus as our "twin sister" due to its comparable size and density to Earth. However, the problem is that every attempt to explore Venus using spacecraft has failed. Venus is often called Earth's "twin" because it is the closest to Earth in terms of density and size. This difficulty might explain why no spacecraft has landed on Venus in over three decades. According to NASA, they are determined to gather the necessary research to assess Venus's habitability, despite the challenges.

NASA is exploring alternative methods to approach Venus, conducting various tests to ensure the spacecraft can withstand the planet's harsh conditions. For instance, "some simplified electronics made of silicon carbide have been tested in a chamber simulating the chaos of Venus's surface and have lasted for three weeks." Another reason to study Venus closely is the limited usefulness of observations made from orbit. "Peering at Venus from a ship orbiting or hovering safely far above the planet can provide only limited insight into ground conditions, as the dense atmosphere prevents most forms of light from penetrating, rendering standard photography and videography ineffective." Venus's challenging conditions also prevent the capture of adequate photographs and the safe landing of rovers to collect samples. "Researchers cannot take samples of rock, gas, or anything else, from a distance."

Despite the conditions, scientists are determined to find a way to have a person land and gather the necessary information. Venus is not seen as a threat, but rather a challenge. However, the fragility of the human body necessitates the continued use of rovers.

On April 5, 1998, Mars Global Surveyor flew over Cydonia and captured a picture that was ten times sharper than the original Viking photos. The image appeared on the JPL website, and thousands of people eagerly awaited its reveal. The picture showed that the supposed face on Mars was simply a natural landform, not an alien monument, disappointing those who believed otherwise.

The article about the face on Mars explains that scientists initially thought it was a Martian mesa, a common occurrence in Cydonia, with unusual shadows that resembled an Egyptian Pharaoh. The shadows gave the illusion of a human face, leading some to speculate about extraterrestrial origins. However, subsequent investigations revealed that the face was a product of natural processes, not alien intervention.

Despite the face bearing a striking resemblance to a human visage, complete with a nose, eyes, and a mouth, scientific analysis confirmed that it was a lava dome, a landform shaped by natural forces. The article points out that the face's features were a result of shadows, highlighting the role of perception in interpreting the Martian landscape.

In conclusion, the face on Mars, while intriguing, is a geological formation, not a sign of alien activity. The attention it receives only serves to fuel speculation, diverting focus from genuine scientific discoveries.

Cecil had always been one of those teenage boys with limbs so long that his brain signals seemed to take forever to reach their intended target. Every adult who looked at him wore an expression of perpetual pity. Even at twenty, he still had more elbows than sense. So, when a jar of tomato puree smashed across the kitchen tiles, he was more resigned than surprised.

Of course, on this particular Sunday, Cecil could have done without any unforeseen accidents. The little ring in a velvet box in his pocket cost enough to make even a poker player wince. Blanche was coming to dinner, and Cecil had promised great things. Great things did not include glass and tomatoes spread across the kitchen in equal measure.

"Ah," Cecil said as he cut his foot, "That hurt." He hopped to the kitchen sink to fetch a washcloth, knocking a chair while getting down on one knee. On the table sat four candles Cecil had found in a cupboard, hidden in case of a blackout. One fell over, setting the white tablecloth lazily on fire, as though it couldn't decide whether to blaze or simply singe.

Cecil attempted to mop up the tomatoes on the floor, spreading them around hopelessly. On the stove, the pasta began to boil over, white froth and foam tipping onto the gas flame and threatening to extinguish it. The washcloth succeeded only in getting red sauce where the tiles had previously been clean. Pieces of glass crunched into Cecil's knee.

"Ah," he said again. "Oh dear. I need some help."

The tomato sauce on the floor began to bubble, with strands of roiling pulp shifting around like snakes. Cecil stood quickly and reached for the recipe book. On the table, the white tablecloth finally succumbed and started to blaze merrily. Moving backward, Cecil clutched the spice rack for support, only to scatter a mixture of parsley and oregano on the floor. The tomato mixture spat and hissed. The tiles of the kitchen cracked like hot fissures in the earth, with steam leaking out like great curling tentacles.

"Who calls?" came a voice from the depths.

Cecil's knees knocked together.

"Er, I do," he said, as the tiles moved like tectonic plates to reveal a dark hole, darker than the deepest black of a goth's outfit. "I'm Cecil."

The pasta water behind him frothed and boiled, sending long waterfalls of white foam over the side of the silver pan. Overhead, the lights flickered like a cheap show at the amateur dramatics society. The tomato puree frowned at him.

"What do you want, Cecil?" the voice said again. "My great powers are at your service."

The white tablecloth sent showers of black ash into the air. Two hands emerged from the hole: veined, leathery, with long fingernails crusted with blood (or tomato), and Cecil thought now would be a good time to have a heart attack, wondering if Blanche would forgive him for escaping their afternoon meal.

قال مستشار وزير التموين للمعلومات، عمرو عبد المنعم، إن هناك 3 ملايين مواطن يستفيدون من دعم السلع التموينية دون وجه حق. أكد أن الوزارة ستقدم كل من تواطأ وأفسد إلى الجهات المختصة من الموظفين وأصحاب المخابز للمحاسبة. وأضاف خلال لقاءه في برنامج "على مسؤوليتي" على قناة "صدى البلد" أن منظومة التموين الجديدة ستغلق أبواب التلاعب بالسلع التموينية. كما أشار إلى أن هذه المنظومة ستسمح للمواطن بتتبع تجديد أو إصدار البطاقة في حال فقدانها أو تلفها من خلال خدمة الرسائل النصية.

شكراً لقراءة خبر عن وائل جسار الذي كشف أسراراً من حياته لأمير كرارة: "أحب المقالب.. وسأبعد ابنتي عن الفن"، والآن مع تفاصيل الخبر:

القاهرة - بقلم محمد صلاح - كشف النجم وائل جسار أثناء استضافته في برنامج "سهرانين" مع أمير كرارة عن العديد من الجوانب في شخصيته. تحدث عن علاقته بأسرته بالإضافة إلى العديد من الأمور الأخرى في حياته، وسنستعرض أبرزها في السطور التالية.

محب للبقاء في المنزل:
أكد النجم وائل جسار أنه بسبب عمله، يستغل أي فرصة أو إجازة للعيش مع أبنائه، مفضلاً عدم السهر خارج المنزل والبقاء مع عائلته، نظراً لأنه في أغلب الأوقات يكون خارج البيت.

لا يريد لابنته دخول الفن:
كشف وائل جسار أنه لا يفضل مطلقاً أن تصبح ابنته فنانة أو تدخل الوسط الفني، مشيراً إلى صعوبة هذه المهنة بشكل كبير. وأكد في الوقت نفسه أنه سيدعمها في حال إصرارها على الدخول في المجال.

عاشق للمقالب:
أكد وائل جسار أنه على عكس الشخصية الهادئة التي يُعرف بها، يفضل عمل المقالب مع أصدقائه من الفرقة الغنائية، وخاصة خلال رحلات الطيران معهم.

هنري كيسنجر، وزير الخارجية الأمريكي الأسبق، شدد على أهمية تحديد الولايات المتحدة والصين لحدود واضحة للمواجهة بينهما، محذراً من أن العالم قد يجد نفسه في وضع مشابه للحرب العالمية الأولى إذا لم يتم تحقيق ذلك. 

وأشار تقرير لوكالة "بلومبيرغ" إلى اعتقاد كيسنجر بأن النزاع الحالي بين الولايات المتحدة والصين يمكن أن يوصف بأنه "حرب باردة جديدة"، مؤكداً أن رسم حدود لهذه المواجهة أمر ضروري لتحقيق خفض عام في التصعيد. 

في سياق حديثه عن ضرورة وضع حدود، قال كيسنجر: "يمكنكم القول إن هذا الأمر مستحيل تماما. لكن إذا كان هذا مستحيلا تماما، فسنجد أنفسنا في وضع مشابه للحرب العالمية الأولى".

ويرى كيسنجر أن التوتر بين واشنطن وبكين ناتج عن ظهور تقنيات جديدة غيرت المشهد الجيوسياسي. 

كما أكد، وهو المعروف بلقب "ثعلب الدبلوماسية الأمريكية"، قناعته بضرورة إدراك الولايات المتحدة للمتغيرات في العالم الحديث، مشيراً إلى أن هذه المتغيرات معقدة للغاية بحيث لا يمكن لدولة واحدة الحفاظ على هيمنتها في المجالين الاقتصادي والاستراتيجي في نفس الوقت.

Unless you've been living under a rock, chances are you've already come across the cringe-worthy music video titled 'I Don't Wanna Know,' which offers more amusement than actual enjoyment. If you haven't watched it yet, I recommend you steer clear.

The song is the creation of the up-and-coming musician Mercelline Onyango, also known as Mercy Atis, hailing from Malindi, who has a compelling story to share. Read on below.

********************************

“When I shared my latest song, 'I Don't Wanna Know,' on Facebook and YouTube under my stage name Mercy Atis, I never anticipated it would go viral. The decision to release the song was impulsive, as I stumbled upon a producer willing to shoot the video for Sh5,000.

Thinking it was a fair deal, I quickly got ready, did my makeup and chose my wardrobe. As a single mother of two children, aged three and one, who I was also breastfeeding, I had no one to look after them, so I brought them along. Their presence caused many interruptions, dragging the shoot over four days.

Criticism poured in from various quarters, targeting my producer, my attire, my body, and my makeup. However, the most hurtful were the thousands of comments claiming I couldn't sing. Despite the song circulating on social media and even receiving airplay on some radio stations, as a budding artist, this should have brought me joy.

Nevertheless, the first two nights were tough as I pondered why people were being so harsh. My life has been marred by a series of mistakes, one after another. This was my shot at a second chance, yet many wouldn't let me move forward.

In 2014, after serving time in a US prison, I was deported back to Kenya. I returned on a military plane from California, dressed in a hospital gown, accompanied by eight individuals, including a doctor and a therapist.

Returning as a deportee with no money or assets, there seemed to be no silver lining. However, on my journey back, I had one resolution—to pursue a career as a musician.

Previous life

How did I end up here? In 2005, I left Kenya on a student visa to the USA, sponsored by a local church from my hometown in Kisumu. The plan was to promote Christian books for the church and enroll in a nursing course. I became a Certified Nursing Assistant, obtained my certificate, and even began working when my life took a dark turn. In 2009, I was arrested for arson and served a five-year sentence.

Before boarding the flight back home, I spent nine months in an immigration detention center, including a two-month hunger strike. Upon my return, I stayed with a friend as relations with my family were strained. However, we have since reconciled and are in a better place.

Street vending

I sold water on the streets to make ends meet and later traveled to Kisumu, where I reconnected with an old friend who owned a music studio. During my time in incarceration, I had written about 600 songs seeking solace through music.

He assisted me in recording a few songs that didn't gain traction but solidified my dream of becoming a musician. I eventually relocated to Malindi.

In addition to music, I took on odd jobs, launched a YouTube channel, and opened a salon which I had to close due to financial struggles brought about by the COVID-19 pandemic. Currently, I'm exploring online marketing. Although I had plans for more music releases this year, financial constraints have held me back.

Phony companions

The release of my viral song couldn't have been more timely. Surrounding me were fake friends, some of whom were involved in my arrest last year over allegations of operating an adult site, a legal matter I can't discuss further as it's still in court. The song was a message to them.

The song has garnered over 85k views on YouTube alone, with the comments section on Facebook overflowing. The remarks were disheartening. I sifted through over 2,000 comments, hoping to find constructive criticism like, ‘Your fashion sense could use improvement. I'd love to help style you,' or, ‘I'm willing to offer makeup tips.’ Regrettably, none surfaced, and even those I reached out to for assistance vanished.

Taking heed of the feedback, I'm now working with a personal trainer to get in shape and plan to engage a professional makeup artist in the future.

I'm already in the midst of shooting another song, delayed due to financial constraints. The five years behind bars taught me resilience and courage, urging us to start anew. What caught me off guard was that those urging for change might be the same individuals mocking your progress.”

Hilary Duff took to Instagram to share that the much-anticipated Lizzie McGuire revival series for Disney+ has been officially canceled. The actress expressed her disappointment, acknowledging the extensive efforts that had been made to bring back the beloved character. She emphasized the importance of portraying Lizzie authentically and honestly in the present day, mentioning the tribute to the amazing woman Lizzie could have become and the adventures fans could have shared with her. Despite the cast and crew giving their best, the revival did not come to fruition.

Originally set to reprise her role as an older Lizzie McGuire, Duff was to be joined by returning stars Adam Lamberg, Hallie Todd, Robert Carradine, and Jake Thomas. However, the show faced challenges early on as Terri Minsky, the creator of the original series, departed from her role as showrunner after filming two episodes. Disney explained that a different creative direction was needed, leading to a halt in production.

The Lizzie McGuire franchise, which originally aired from 2000 to 2004 on the Disney Channel and included a 2003 film, The Lizzie McGuire Movie, has been a staple for many fans. Duff's announcement came amidst personal news, as she revealed in October that she is expecting her third child. In the midst of disappointment, she encouraged everyone to look towards the future and the possibilities it holds.

Two men in suits stood looking over the Nova Scotian coastline. Just off the beach, a metal craft sat half submerged in the water. The full moon reflecting off the water seemed blinding as they stood watching the waves rise and fall.

The taller of the two men, Agent Cardiff, turned around and walked to a black SUV. He opened the driver's side door, reached back, and pulled out a small box with a tube attached. Slamming the door shut, he turned to walk towards the other man.

The shorter man, Agent Birmingham, put his hand to his ear and spoke in a deep, raspy voice, reminiscent of an 80-year-old man. "Yes, sir. We have already spoken to Canadian officials, and they will allow us to move it." A pause ensued. "Of course. Agent Cardiff has retrieved the Geiger counter and we will search for any trace amounts." Another pause, longer this time. "No. We weren't supposed to, were we? I was not informed to... Good. We'll start our search and we should be done by the time the ship is here." He pulled his hand away from his ear as Cardiff stopped next to him.

"Ya know, Birm, what if something is alive in there? We don't want another New Mexico incident." Cardiff asked.

"I certainly hope it isn't the same thing as the one in New Mexico. For your sake, after all, you are the one holding a box and rod. At least I have a gun," replied Birmingham.

Cardiff sighed, "Let's get this over with." He started down towards the beach with his partner in tow. Cardiff grabbed the end of the Geiger counter and began looking over the wreckage. The device remained silent for 15 minutes of searching.

"Well, no sign of radiation, not even at the engines. Guess we'll wait til our guys arrive, and we can pop this thing open."

- - -

Jakob wasn't a big fan of old Earth. He awoke in what was left of his ship, hearing some loud noises—maybe old raid sirens—then was blinded with light as people burned a hole in his ship when they could have just opened the door. They put him in some odd metal chain link that restricted his hands, similar to handcuffs. They shouted at him in English, albeit with odd accents, and pushed him into a white room with a mirror on one side. Two men in suits sat at the table in the room.

"Hello sir, my name is Agent Cardiff and this is my partner Agent Birmingham. We would like to ask you a few questions," said Cardiff, shuffling some papers.

"Call me Jakob," he responded.

Agent Cardiff scribbled something down. "It's with a k, not a c."

"Alright. Why were you in what appears to be an alien spacecraft?" Cardiff asked.

"Didn't you say simple stuff?" Jakob quipped, making Agent Birmingham smirk while Cardiff remained unfazed.

"I did but the people above me are a bit impatient. They want the major details. So?" Cardiff pressed on.

"I have been sent back in time 80 years with my sister," Jakob explained, glancing towards the door, "to warn humanity of an alien invasion. The Jenthins are not as nice as we thought."

Agent Cardiff and Agent Birmingham exchanged worried glances. This time, it was Birmingham who spoke up. "There are at least three international laws you just broke in saying that sentence. First off, saying an alien force will invade is a capital crime. Secondly, you spoke of the Jenthins. Also a capital punishment. Saying you have time traveled is also a capital crime.

In the article about the Mona Lisa's smile, a new technology called the Facial Action Coding System (FACS) is discussed. This technology analyzes the Mona Lisa's smile using computer software to determine the percentage of each emotion she is expressing. According to the article, FACS can provide detailed insights into a person's emotions. As mentioned in paragraph 6, "A classroom computer could recognize when a student is becoming confused or bored." I believe this is a smart innovation, as it can reveal when a person is sad even if they have a smile on their face, indicating their true feelings at a given moment.

Humans express the same emotions daily, whether they are happy or sad. The article states that there are "44 muscles, just like human muscles," that can convey emotions and the intensity of those emotions. Sometimes, the system compares a face to a neutral one to highlight the differences.

"Hum Saath Saath Hai" is a 1999 family drama directed by Sooraj Barjatya, known for its talented cast and enchanting storyline. The movie follows an elderly couple with three sons, portrayed by Saif Ali Khan, Salman Khan, and Monish Bahl, as they navigate relationships and discover love.

The film is filled with heartwarming scenes that may bring tears to your eyes. Fans have cherished the performances of Sonali Bendre, Karisma Kapoor, and Tabu sharing the screen. Alok Nath shines as the family patriarch, Ramkishen. Here are some standout moments from the movie:

1. Preeti's Comforting Gesture
Sonali, as Preeti, consoles Salman's character, Prem, in a touching scene where emotions run high. Their interaction, as Preeti offers him traditional Indian food, showcases a tender connection that will resonate with viewers.

2. Family Bonding
A memorable scene captures the entire family coming together to reminisce and celebrate. The light-hearted moment takes a humorous turn when an unexpected guest indulges in all the food prepared by Ramkishen's wife, adding a delightful touch to the family gathering.

3. Prem's Return
Vivek visits a doctor in a scene that transitions to a discussion about Prem's impending arrival. The family eagerly anticipates his return, showering him with affectionate praise. Their recount of Prem's thoughtful gesture of not wanting them to fuss over his airport pick-up reflects the close-knit nature of the family.
